44CFaceOfElement::CFaceOfElement() {
45 nCornerPoints = 0;
46 cornerPoints[0] = cornerPoints[1] = cornerPoints[2] = cornerPoints[3] = ULONG_MAX;
47 elemID0 = elemID1 = ULONG_MAX;
48 nPolyGrid0 = nPolyGrid1 = 0;
49 nPolySol0 = nPolySol1 = 0;
50 nDOFsElem0 = nDOFsElem1 = 0;
51 elemType0 = elemType1 = 0;
52 faceID0 = faceID1 = 0;
53 periodicIndex = periodicIndexDonor = 0;
54 faceIndicator = 0;
55
56 JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = false;
57 elem0IsOwner = false;
58}
59
60CFaceOfElement::CFaceOfElement(const unsigned short VTK_Type, const unsigned short nPoly, const unsigned long* Nodes) {
61 /* Set the default values of the member variables. */
62 nCornerPoints = 0;
63 cornerPoints[0] = cornerPoints[1] = cornerPoints[2] = cornerPoints[3] = ULONG_MAX;
64 elemID0 = elemID1 = ULONG_MAX;
65 nPolyGrid0 = nPolyGrid1 = 0;
66 nPolySol0 = nPolySol1 = 0;
67 nDOFsElem0 = nDOFsElem1 = 0;
68 elemType0 = elemType1 = 0;
69 faceID0 = faceID1 = 0;
70 periodicIndex = periodicIndexDonor = 0;
71 faceIndicator = 0;
72
73 JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = false;
74 elem0IsOwner = false;
75
76 /* Determine the face element type and set the corner points accordingly. */
77 switch (VTK_Type) {
78 case LINE: {
79 nCornerPoints = 2;
80 cornerPoints[0] = Nodes[0];
81 cornerPoints[1] = Nodes[nPoly];
82 break;
83 }
84
85 case TRIANGLE: {
86 const unsigned short ind2 = (nPoly + 1) * (nPoly + 2) / 2 - 1;
87 nCornerPoints = 3;
88 cornerPoints[0] = Nodes[0];
89 cornerPoints[1] = Nodes[nPoly];
90 cornerPoints[2] = Nodes[ind2];
91 break;
92 }
93
94 case QUADRILATERAL: {
95 const unsigned short ind2 = nPoly * (nPoly + 1);
96 const unsigned short ind3 = (nPoly + 1) * (nPoly + 1) - 1;
97 nCornerPoints = 4;
98 cornerPoints[0] = Nodes[0];
99 cornerPoints[1] = Nodes[nPoly];
100 cornerPoints[2] = Nodes[ind2];
101 cornerPoints[3] = Nodes[ind3];
102 break;
103 }
104
105 default: {
106 ostringstream message;
107 message << "Unknown VTK surface element type, " << VTK_Type;
108 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
109 }
110 }
111}
112
113bool CFaceOfElement::operator<(const CFaceOfElement& other) const {
114 if (nCornerPoints != other.nCornerPoints) return nCornerPoints < other.nCornerPoints;
115
116 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nCornerPoints; ++i)
117 if (cornerPoints[i] != other.cornerPoints[i]) return cornerPoints[i] < other.cornerPoints[i];
118
119 return false;
120}
121
122bool CFaceOfElement::operator==(const CFaceOfElement& other) const {
123 if (nCornerPoints != other.nCornerPoints) return false;
124 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nCornerPoints; ++i)
125 if (cornerPoints[i] != other.cornerPoints[i]) return false;
126
127 return true;
128}
129
130void CFaceOfElement::Copy(const CFaceOfElement& other) {
131 nCornerPoints = other.nCornerPoints;
132 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nCornerPoints; ++i) cornerPoints[i] = other.cornerPoints[i];
133 for (unsigned short i = nCornerPoints; i < 4; ++i) cornerPoints[i] = ULONG_MAX;
134
135 elemID0 = other.elemID0;
136 elemID1 = other.elemID1;
137
138 nPolyGrid0 = other.nPolyGrid0;
139 nPolyGrid1 = other.nPolyGrid1;
140 nPolySol0 = other.nPolySol0;
141 nPolySol1 = other.nPolySol1;
142
143 nDOFsElem0 = other.nDOFsElem0;
144 nDOFsElem1 = other.nDOFsElem1;
145 elemType0 = other.elemType0;
146 elemType1 = other.elemType1;
147 faceID0 = other.faceID0;
148 faceID1 = other.faceID1;
149
150 periodicIndex = other.periodicIndex;
151 periodicIndexDonor = other.periodicIndexDonor;
152 faceIndicator = other.faceIndicator;
153
154 JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = other.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant;
155 elem0IsOwner = other.elem0IsOwner;
156}
157
158void CFaceOfElement::CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation() {
159 /*--- Determine the element type and create the unique numbering accordingly. ---*/
160 bool swapElements = false;
161 switch (nCornerPoints) {
162 case 2: {
163 /* Element is a line. Check if the node numbering must be swapped. If so
164 also the element information must be swapped, because element 0 is to
165 the left of the face and element 1 to the right. */
166 if (cornerPoints[1] < cornerPoints[0]) {
167 swap(cornerPoints[0], cornerPoints[1]);
168 swapElements = true;
169 }
170 break;
171 }
172
173 case 3: {
174 /* Element is a triangle. The vertices are sorted in increasing order.
175 If the sequence of the new numbering is opposite to the current
176 numbering, the element information must be exchanged, because
177 element 0 is to the left of the face and element 1 to the right. */
178 unsigned long nn[] = {cornerPoints[0], cornerPoints[1], cornerPoints[2]};
179 unsigned short ind = 0;
180 if (nn[1] < nn[ind]) ind = 1;
181 if (nn[2] < nn[ind]) ind = 2;
182
183 unsigned short indm1 = ind == 0 ? 2 : ind - 1; // Next lower index.
184 unsigned short indp1 = ind == 2 ? 0 : ind + 1; // Next upper index.
185
186 if (nn[indp1] < nn[indm1]) {
187 /* The orientation of the triangle remains the same.
188 Store the new sorted node numbering. */
189 cornerPoints[0] = nn[ind];
190 cornerPoints[1] = nn[indp1];
191 cornerPoints[2] = nn[indm1];
192 } else {
193 /* The orientation of the triangle changes. Store the new
194 sorted node numbering and set swapElements to true. */
195 cornerPoints[0] = nn[ind];
196 cornerPoints[1] = nn[indm1];
197 cornerPoints[2] = nn[indp1];
198 swapElements = true;
199 }
200
201 break;
202 }
203
204 case 4: {
205 /* Element is a quadrilateral. The vertices are sorted in increasing order
206 under the condition neighboring vertices remain neighbors. If the
207 sequence of the new numbering is opposite to the current
208 numbering, the element information must be exchanged, because
209 element 0 is to the left of the face and element 1 to the right. */
210 unsigned long nn[] = {cornerPoints[0], cornerPoints[1], cornerPoints[2], cornerPoints[3]};
211 unsigned short ind = 0;
212 if (nn[1] < nn[ind]) ind = 1;
213 if (nn[2] < nn[ind]) ind = 2;
214 if (nn[3] < nn[ind]) ind = 3;
215
216 unsigned short indm1 = ind == 0 ? 3 : ind - 1; // Next lower index.
217 unsigned short indp1 = ind == 3 ? 0 : ind + 1; // Next upper index.
218 unsigned short indp2 = ind >= 2 ? ind - 2 : ind + 2; // Opposite index.
219
220 if (nn[indp1] < nn[indm1]) {
221 /* The orientation of the quadrilateral remains the same.
222 Store the new sorted node numbering. */
223 cornerPoints[0] = nn[ind];
224 cornerPoints[1] = nn[indp1];
225 cornerPoints[2] = nn[indp2];
226 cornerPoints[3] = nn[indm1];
227 } else {
228 /* The orientation of the quadrilateral changes. Store the new
229 sorted node numbering and set swapElements to true. */
230 cornerPoints[0] = nn[ind];
231 cornerPoints[1] = nn[indm1];
232 cornerPoints[2] = nn[indp2];
233 cornerPoints[3] = nn[indp1];
234 swapElements = true;
235 }
236
237 break;
238 }
239
240 default: {
241 ostringstream message;
242 message << "Unknown surface element type with " << nCornerPoints << " corners." << endl;
243 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
244 }
245 }
246
247 /* Swap the element information, if needed. */
248 if (swapElements) {
249 swap(elemID0, elemID1);
250 swap(nPolyGrid0, nPolyGrid1);
251 swap(nPolySol0, nPolySol1);
252 swap(nDOFsElem0, nDOFsElem1);
253 swap(elemType0, elemType1);
254 swap(faceID0, faceID1);
255 }
256}

258void CBoundaryFace::Copy(const CBoundaryFace& other) {
259 VTK_Type = other.VTK_Type;
260 nPolyGrid = other.nPolyGrid;
261 nDOFsGrid = other.nDOFsGrid;
262 globalBoundElemID = other.globalBoundElemID;
263 domainElementID = other.domainElementID;
264 Nodes = other.Nodes;
265}

267CMatchingFace::CMatchingFace() {
268 nCornerPoints = 0;
269 nDim = 0;
270 nPoly = 0;
271 nDOFsElem = 0;
272 elemType = 0;
273 elemID = 0;
274
275 cornerCoor[0][0] = cornerCoor[0][1] = cornerCoor[0][2] = 0.0;
276 cornerCoor[1][0] = cornerCoor[1][1] = cornerCoor[1][2] = 0.0;
277 cornerCoor[2][0] = cornerCoor[2][1] = cornerCoor[2][2] = 0.0;
278 cornerCoor[3][0] = cornerCoor[3][1] = cornerCoor[3][2] = 0.0;
279
280 tolForMatching = 0.0;
281}
282
283bool CMatchingFace::operator<(const CMatchingFace& other) const {
284 /* First compare the number of corner points. ---*/
285 if (nCornerPoints != other.nCornerPoints) return nCornerPoints < other.nCornerPoints;
286
287 /*--- Determine the tolerance for comparing both objects. ---*/
288 const su2double tol = min(tolForMatching, other.tolForMatching);
289
290 /*--- Loop over the number of corner points and dimensions and compare the
291 coordinates. If considered different, return true if the current face
292 is considered smaller and false otherwise. ---*/
293 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nCornerPoints; ++k) {
294 for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) {
295 if (fabs(cornerCoor[k][l] - other.cornerCoor[k][l]) > tol) return cornerCoor[k][l] < other.cornerCoor[k][l];
296 }
297 }
298
299 /*--- Both objects are considered the same. Return false. ---*/
300 return false;
301}
302
303void CMatchingFace::SortFaceCoordinates() {
304 /*--- Determine the tolerance for a matching point for this face. This is
305 accomplished by computing the minimum distance between the points of
306 the face, multiplied by a relative tolerance. ---*/
307 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nCornerPoints; ++k) {
308 for (unsigned short j = (k + 1); j < nCornerPoints; ++j) {
309 su2double dist = 0.0;
310 for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) {
311 su2double ds = cornerCoor[k][l] - cornerCoor[j][l];
312 dist += ds * ds;
313 }
314 dist = sqrt(dist);
315
316 if (k == 0 && j == 1)
317 tolForMatching = dist;
318 else
319 tolForMatching = min(tolForMatching, dist);
320 }
321 }
322
323 tolForMatching *= 1.e-6;
324
325 /*--- Sort the points in increasing order based on the coordinates.
326 An insertion sort algorithm is used, which is quite efficient
327 for at most four corner points. ---*/
328 for (unsigned short k = 1; k < nCornerPoints; ++k) {
329 for (unsigned short j = k; j > 0; --j) {
330 /* Check if cornerCoor[j] is considered less than cornerCoor[j-1]. */
331 bool lessThan = false;
332 for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) {
333 if (fabs(cornerCoor[j][l] - cornerCoor[j - 1][l]) > tolForMatching) {
334 lessThan = cornerCoor[j][l] < cornerCoor[j - 1][l];
335 break;
336 }
337 }
338
339 /* If cornerCoor[j] is less than cornerCoor[j-1] they must be swapped.
340 Otherwise an exit can be made from the j-loop. */
341 if (lessThan) {
342 for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) swap(cornerCoor[j][l], cornerCoor[j - 1][l]);
343 } else
344 break;
345 }
346 }
347}
348
349void CMatchingFace::Copy(const CMatchingFace& other) {
350 nCornerPoints = other.nCornerPoints;
351 nDim = other.nDim;
352 nPoly = other.nPoly;
353 nDOFsElem = other.nDOFsElem;
354 elemType = other.elemType;
355 elemID = other.elemID;
356
357 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nCornerPoints; ++k) {
358 for (unsigned l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) {
359 cornerCoor[k][l] = other.cornerCoor[k][l];
360 }
361 }
362
363 tolForMatching = other.tolForMatching;
364}
365
366void CPhysicalGeometry::Read_SU2_Format_Parallel_FEM(CConfig* config, const string& val_mesh_filename,
367 unsigned short val_iZone, unsigned short val_nZone) {
368 string text_line, Marker_Tag;
369 ifstream mesh_file;
370 string::size_type position;
371 unsigned long nDOFsGrid_Local = 0, loc_element_count = 0;
372 bool domain_flag = false;
373 bool time_spectral = config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::HARMONIC_BALANCE;
374 unsigned short nMarker_Max = config->GetnMarker_Max();
375 nZone = val_nZone;
376
377 /*--- Initialize counters for local/global points & elements ---*/
378 Global_nPoint = 0;
379 Global_nPointDomain = 0;
380 Global_nElem = 0;
381 nelem_edge = 0;
382 Global_nelem_edge = 0;
383 nelem_triangle = 0;
384 Global_nelem_triangle = 0;
385 nelem_quad = 0;
386 Global_nelem_quad = 0;
387 nelem_tetra = 0;
388 Global_nelem_tetra = 0;
389 nelem_hexa = 0;
390 Global_nelem_hexa = 0;
391 nelem_prism = 0;
392 Global_nelem_prism = 0;
393 nelem_pyramid = 0;
394 Global_nelem_pyramid = 0;
395
396 /*--- Allocate memory for the linear partition of the elements of the mesh.
397 These arrays are the size of the number of ranks. ---*/
398
399 beg_node = new unsigned long[size];
400 end_node = new unsigned long[size];
401 nPointLinear = new unsigned long[size];
402
403 /*--- Open grid file ---*/
404
405 mesh_file.open(val_mesh_filename.c_str(), ios::in);
406
407 /*--- Check the grid ---*/
408
409 if (mesh_file.fail())
410 SU2_MPI::Error(string("There is no mesh file (CPhysicalGeometry)!! ") + val_mesh_filename, CURRENT_FUNCTION);
411
412 /*--- If more than one, find the zone in the mesh file ---*/
413
414 if (val_nZone > 1 || time_spectral) {
415 if (time_spectral) {
416 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) cout << "Reading time spectral instance " << val_iZone + 1 << ":" << endl;
417 } else {
418 while (getline(mesh_file, text_line)) {
419 /*--- Search for the current domain ---*/
420 position = text_line.find("IZONE=", 0);
421 if (position != string::npos) {
422 text_line.erase(0, 6);
423 unsigned short jDomain = atoi(text_line.c_str());
424 if (jDomain == val_iZone + 1) {
425 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) cout << "Reading zone " << val_iZone + 1 << " points:" << endl;
426 break;
427 }
428 }
429 }
430 }
431 }
432
433 /*--- Read grid file with format SU2 ---*/
434
435 while (getline(mesh_file, text_line)) {
436 /*--- Read the dimension of the problem ---*/
437
438 position = text_line.find("NDIME=", 0);
439 if (position != string::npos) {
440 if (!domain_flag) {
441 text_line.erase(0, 6);
442 nDim = atoi(text_line.c_str());
443 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
444 if (nDim == 2) cout << "Two dimensional problem." << endl;
445 if (nDim == 3) cout << "Three dimensional problem." << endl;
446 }
447 domain_flag = true;
448 } else {
449 break;
450 }
451 }
452
453 /*--- Read the information about inner elements ---*/
454
455 position = text_line.find("NELEM=", 0);
456 if (position != string::npos) {
457 text_line.erase(0, 6);
458 stringstream stream_line(text_line);
459 stream_line >> Global_nElem;
460
461 if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size > SINGLE_NODE))
462 cout << Global_nElem << " interior elements before parallel partitioning." << endl;
463
464 /*--- Check if the number of cores used is larger than the number of
465 elements. Terminate if this is the case, because it does not make
466 sense to do this. ---*/
467 unsigned long nCores = size; // Correct for the number of cores per rank.
468 if (nCores > Global_nElem) {
469 ostringstream message;
470 message << "The number of cores, " << nCores;
471 message << ", is larger than the number of elements, " << Global_nElem << "." << endl;
472 message << "This is not an efficient use of the resources and therefore "
473 << "SU2 will terminate.";
474
475 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
476 }
477
478 /*--- Compute the number of elements that will be on each processor.
479 This is a linear partitioning with the addition of a simple load
480 balancing for any remainder elements. ---*/
481 unsigned long total_elem_accounted = 0;
482 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < (unsigned long)size; i++) {
483 nPointLinear[i] = Global_nElem / size;
484 total_elem_accounted = total_elem_accounted + nPointLinear[i];
485 }
486
487 /*--- Get the number of remainder elements after the even division ---*/
488 unsigned long rem_elem = Global_nElem - total_elem_accounted;
489 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < rem_elem; i++) {
490 ++nPointLinear[i];
491 }
492
493 /*--- Store the local number of elements and the beginning/end index ---*/
494 nElem = nPointLinear[rank];
495 beg_node[0] = 0;
496 end_node[0] = beg_node[0] + nPointLinear[0];
497 for (unsigned long i = 1; i < (unsigned long)size; i++) {
498 beg_node[i] = end_node[i - 1];
499 end_node[i] = beg_node[i] + nPointLinear[i];
500 }
501
502 /*--- Allocate space for elements ---*/
503 elem = new CPrimalGrid*[nElem]();
504
505 /*--- Loop over all the elements and store the elements to be stored on
506 this rank. Furthermore, determine the total amount of DOFs for
507 the solution (which may differ from the number of DOFS for the
508 grid). ---*/
509 unsigned long nDOFs_tot = 0;
510 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < Global_nElem; i++) {
511 getline(mesh_file, text_line);
512 istringstream elem_line(text_line);
513
514 /*--- Read the value that defines the element type, the polynomial
515 degree of the geometry and the polynomial degree of the
516 solution. Extract this info as well. ---*/
517 unsigned long typeRead;
518 elem_line >> typeRead;
519 unsigned long typeReadErrorMessage = typeRead;
520 unsigned short nPolySol, nPolyGrid;
521 if (typeRead > 10000) {
522 nPolySol = typeRead / 10000 - 1;
523 typeRead = typeRead % 10000;
524 nPolyGrid = typeRead / 100 + 1;
525 } else {
526 nPolyGrid = typeRead / 100 + 1;
527 nPolySol = nPolyGrid;
528 }
529
530 unsigned short VTK_Type = typeRead % 100;
531
532 unsigned short nDOFsGrid = CFEMStandardElementBase::GetNDOFsStatic(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, typeReadErrorMessage);
533 unsigned short nDOFsSol = CFEMStandardElementBase::GetNDOFsStatic(VTK_Type, nPolySol, typeReadErrorMessage);
534
535 /*--- Allocate the memory for a new primary grid FEM element if
536 this element must be stored on this rank. ---*/
537 if ((i >= beg_node[rank]) && (i < end_node[rank])) {
538 elem[loc_element_count] =
539 new CPrimalGridFEM(i, VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, nPolySol, nDOFsGrid, nDOFsSol, nDOFs_tot, elem_line);
540 nDOFsGrid_Local += nDOFsGrid;
541 loc_element_count++;
542 }
543
544 /*--- Update the total value of the number of DOFs. ---*/
545 nDOFs_tot += nDOFsSol;
546 }
547
548 /*--- Break from the loop to find the element information. ---*/
549 break;
550 }
551 }
552
553 mesh_file.close();
554
555 /*--- Create a vector, which contains the global node IDs of the local elements. ---*/
556 vector<unsigned long> nodeIDsElemLoc;
557 nodeIDsElemLoc.reserve(nDOFsGrid_Local);
558 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < loc_element_count; i++) {
559 unsigned short nDOFsElem = elem[i]->GetnNodes();
560 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFsElem; ++j) nodeIDsElemLoc.push_back(elem[i]->GetNode(j));
561 }
562
563 sort(nodeIDsElemLoc.begin(), nodeIDsElemLoc.end());
564 vector<unsigned long>::iterator lastNode;
565 lastNode = unique(nodeIDsElemLoc.begin(), nodeIDsElemLoc.end());
566 nodeIDsElemLoc.erase(lastNode, nodeIDsElemLoc.end());
567
568 /*--- Allocate the memory for the coordinates to be stored on this rank. ---*/
569 nPoint = nodeIDsElemLoc.size();
570 nodes = new CPoint(nPoint, nDim);
571
572 /*--- Open the grid file again and go to the position where
573 the correct zone is stored. ---*/
574 mesh_file.open(val_mesh_filename.c_str(), ios::in);
575
576 if (val_nZone > 1 && !time_spectral) {
577 while (getline(mesh_file, text_line)) {
578 position = text_line.find("IZONE=", 0);
579 if (position != string::npos) {
580 text_line.erase(0, 6);
581 unsigned short jDomain = atoi(text_line.c_str());
582 if (jDomain == val_iZone + 1) break;
583 }
584 }
585 }
586
587 /*--- While loop to read the point information. ---*/
588 while (getline(mesh_file, text_line)) {
589 position = text_line.find("NPOIN=", 0);
590 if (position != string::npos) {
591 text_line.erase(0, 6);
592 stringstream stream_line(text_line);
593 stream_line >> Global_nPoint;
594
595 /*--- Loop over the global number of points and store the
596 ones that are needed on this processor. ---*/
597 unsigned long ii = 0;
598 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < Global_nPoint; ++i) {
599 getline(mesh_file, text_line);
600
601 if (binary_search(nodeIDsElemLoc.begin(), nodeIDsElemLoc.end(), i)) {
602 istringstream point_line(text_line);
603 su2double Coord[3] = {0.0};
604 point_line >> Coord[0];
605 point_line >> Coord[1];
606 if (nDim == 3) point_line >> Coord[2];
607 nodes->SetCoord(ii, Coord);
608 nodes->SetGlobalIndex(ii, i);
609 ++ii;
610 }
611 }
612
613 break;
614 }
615 }
616
617 mesh_file.close();
618
619 /*--- Determine the faces of the local elements. --- */
620 vector<CFaceOfElement> localFaces;
621 for (unsigned long k = 0; k < loc_element_count; k++) {
622 /*--- Get the global IDs of the corner points of all the faces of this elements. ---*/
623 unsigned short nFaces;
624 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
625 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
626
627 elem[k]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
628
629 /*--- Loop over the faces and add them to localFaces. ---*/
630 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nFaces; ++i) {
631 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
632 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[i];
633 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[i][j];
634 thisFace.elemID0 = k + beg_node[rank];
635
636 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
637 localFaces.push_back(thisFace);
638 }
639 }
640
641 /*--- Sort localFaces in increasing order and remove the double entities,
642 such that the binary search later on is a bit more efficient. ---*/
643 sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
644 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator lastFace;
645 lastFace = unique(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
646 localFaces.erase(lastFace, localFaces.end());
647
648 /*--- Open the grid file again and go to the position where
649 the correct zone is stored. ---*/
650 mesh_file.open(val_mesh_filename.c_str(), ios::in);
651
652 if (val_nZone > 1 && !time_spectral) {
653 while (getline(mesh_file, text_line)) {
654 position = text_line.find("IZONE=", 0);
655 if (position != string::npos) {
656 text_line.erase(0, 6);
657 unsigned short jDomain = atoi(text_line.c_str());
658 if (jDomain == val_iZone + 1) break;
659 }
660 }
661 }
662
663 /*--- While loop to read the boundary information. ---*/
664 while (getline(mesh_file, text_line)) {
665 /*--- Read number of markers ---*/
666 position = text_line.find("NMARK=", 0);
667 if (position != string::npos) {
668 text_line.erase(0, 6);
669 istringstream stream_line(text_line);
670 stream_line >> nMarker;
671
672 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) cout << nMarker << " surface markers." << endl;
673 config->SetnMarker_All(nMarker);
674 bound = new CPrimalGrid**[nMarker];
675 nElem_Bound = new unsigned long[nMarker];
676 Tag_to_Marker = new string[nMarker_Max];
677
678 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
679 getline(mesh_file, text_line);
680 text_line.erase(0, 11);
681 text_line.erase(remove(text_line.begin(), text_line.end(), ' '), text_line.end());
682 text_line.erase(remove(text_line.begin(), text_line.end(), '\r'), text_line.end());
683 text_line.erase(remove(text_line.begin(), text_line.end(), '\n'), text_line.end());
684
685 Marker_Tag = text_line;
686
687 /*--- Read the number of elements for this marker. ---*/
688 getline(mesh_file, text_line);
689 text_line.erase(0, 13);
690 istringstream nmark_line(text_line);
691 unsigned long nElem_Bound_Global;
692 nmark_line >> nElem_Bound_Global;
693 if (rank == MASTER_NODE)
694 cout << nElem_Bound_Global << " boundary elements in index " << iMarker << " (Marker = " << Marker_Tag << ")."
695 << endl;
696
697 /*--- Define a vector of FEM boundary elements to store the local boundary faces. ---*/
698 vector<CBoundaryFace> boundElems;
699
700 /*--- Loop over the global boundary faces. ---*/
701 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem_Bound_Global; ++i) {
702 getline(mesh_file, text_line);
703 istringstream bound_line(text_line);
704
705 /*--- Determine the element type, its number of DOFs and read
706 its node IDs. ---*/
707 unsigned long typeRead;
708 bound_line >> typeRead;
709 unsigned short nPolyGrid = typeRead / 100 + 1;
710 unsigned short VTK_Type = typeRead % 100;
711 unsigned short nDOFEdgeGrid = nPolyGrid + 1;
712
713 unsigned short nDOFsGrid = 0;
714 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
715 thisFace.cornerPoints[0] = 0;
716 thisFace.cornerPoints[1] = nPolyGrid;
717 switch (VTK_Type) {
718 case LINE:
719 nDOFsGrid = nDOFEdgeGrid;
720 thisFace.nCornerPoints = 2;
721 break;
722
723 case TRIANGLE:
724 nDOFsGrid = nDOFEdgeGrid * (nDOFEdgeGrid + 1) / 2;
725 thisFace.nCornerPoints = 3;
726 thisFace.cornerPoints[2] = nDOFsGrid - 1;
727 break;
728
729 case QUADRILATERAL:
730 nDOFsGrid = nDOFEdgeGrid * nDOFEdgeGrid;
731 thisFace.nCornerPoints = 4;
732 thisFace.cornerPoints[2] = nPolyGrid * nDOFEdgeGrid;
733 thisFace.cornerPoints[3] = nDOFsGrid - 1;
734 break;
735
736 default:
737 ostringstream message;
738 message << "Unknown FEM boundary element value, " << typeRead << ", in " << val_mesh_filename;
739 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
740 }
741
742 vector<unsigned long> nodeIDs(nDOFsGrid);
743 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFsGrid; ++j) bound_line >> nodeIDs[j];
744
745 /*--- Convert the local numbering of thisFace to global numbering
746 and create a unique numbering of these nodes. ---*/
747 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < thisFace.nCornerPoints; ++j)
748 thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = nodeIDs[thisFace.cornerPoints[j]];
749 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
750
751 /*--- Check if this boundary face must be stored on this rank.
752 If so, create an object of CBoundaryFace and add it
753 to boundElems. ---*/
754 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
755 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
756 if (low != localFaces.end()) {
757 if (!(thisFace < *low)) {
758 CBoundaryFace thisBoundFace;
759 thisBoundFace.VTK_Type = VTK_Type;
760 thisBoundFace.nPolyGrid = nPolyGrid;
761 thisBoundFace.nDOFsGrid = nDOFsGrid;
762 thisBoundFace.globalBoundElemID = i;
763 thisBoundFace.domainElementID = low->elemID0;
764 thisBoundFace.Nodes = nodeIDs;
765
766 boundElems.push_back(thisBoundFace);
767 }
768 }
769 }
770
771 /*--- Allocate space for the boundary elements and store the ones
772 whose parent element is stored on this rank. ---*/
773 nElem_Bound[iMarker] = boundElems.size();
774 bound[iMarker] = new CPrimalGrid*[nElem_Bound[iMarker]];
775
776 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++i)
777 bound[iMarker][i] = new CPrimalGridBoundFEM(boundElems[i].globalBoundElemID, boundElems[i].domainElementID,
778 boundElems[i].VTK_Type, boundElems[i].nPolyGrid,
779 boundElems[i].nDOFsGrid, boundElems[i].Nodes);
780
781 /*--- Update config information storing the boundary information in the right place ---*/
782 Tag_to_Marker[config->GetMarker_CfgFile_TagBound(Marker_Tag)] = Marker_Tag;
783 config->SetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker, Marker_Tag);
784 config->SetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_KindBC(Marker_Tag));
785 config->SetMarker_All_Monitoring(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Monitoring(Marker_Tag));
786 config->SetMarker_All_GeoEval(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_GeoEval(Marker_Tag));
787 config->SetMarker_All_Designing(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Designing(Marker_Tag));
788 config->SetMarker_All_Plotting(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Plotting(Marker_Tag));
789 config->SetMarker_All_Analyze(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Analyze(Marker_Tag));
790 config->SetMarker_All_ZoneInterface(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_ZoneInterface(Marker_Tag));
791 config->SetMarker_All_DV(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_DV(Marker_Tag));
792 config->SetMarker_All_Moving(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Moving(Marker_Tag));
793 config->SetMarker_All_SobolevBC(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_SobolevBC(Marker_Tag));
794 config->SetMarker_All_PerBound(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_PerBound(Marker_Tag));
795 config->SetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker, NONE);
796 }
797
798 break;
799 }
800 }
801
802 mesh_file.close();
803}
804
805void CPhysicalGeometry::Read_CGNS_Format_Parallel_FEM(CConfig* config, const string& val_mesh_filename,
806 unsigned short val_iZone, unsigned short val_nZone) {
807#ifdef HAVE_CGNS
808
809 /*--- For proper support of the high order elements, at least version 3.3
810 of CGNS must be used. Check this. ---*/
811#if CGNS_VERSION >= 3300
812
813 /*--- Check whether the supplied file is truly a CGNS file. ---*/
814 int file_type;
815 if (cg_is_cgns(val_mesh_filename.c_str(), &file_type) != CG_OK)
816 SU2_MPI::Error(val_mesh_filename + string(" is not a CGNS file that can be read."), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
817
818 /*--- Initialize counters for local/global points & elements ---*/
819 Global_nPoint = 0;
820 Global_nPointDomain = 0;
821 Global_nElem = 0;
822 nelem_edge = 0;
823 Global_nelem_edge = 0;
824 nelem_triangle = 0;
825 Global_nelem_triangle = 0;
826 nelem_quad = 0;
827 Global_nelem_quad = 0;
828 nelem_tetra = 0;
829 Global_nelem_tetra = 0;
830 nelem_hexa = 0;
831 Global_nelem_hexa = 0;
832 nelem_prism = 0;
833 Global_nelem_prism = 0;
834 nelem_pyramid = 0;
835 Global_nelem_pyramid = 0;
836
837 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
838 /*--- Checking of the file, determine the dimensions, etc. ---*/
839 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
840
841 /*--- Allocate memory for the linear partition of the elements of the mesh.
842 These arrays are the size of the number of ranks. ---*/
843 beg_node = new unsigned long[size];
844 end_node = new unsigned long[size];
845 nPointLinear = new unsigned long[size];
846
847 /* Open the CGNS file for reading and check if it went OK. */
848 int fn;
849 if (cg_open(val_mesh_filename.c_str(), CG_MODE_READ, &fn) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
850 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
851 cout << "Reading the CGNS file: " << val_mesh_filename << "." << endl;
852 }
853
854 /* Get the number of databases. This is the highest node in the CGNS heirarchy.
855 The current implementation assumes that there is only one database. */
856 int nbases;
857 if (cg_nbases(fn, &nbases) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
858 if (nbases > 1) {
859 ostringstream message;
860 message << "CGNS file contains " << nbases << " databases." << endl;
861 message << "CGNS reader can handle only 1 at the moment." << endl;
862
863 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
864 }
865
866 /* Read the information of the base, especially the number of dimensions. */
867 char cgnsname[CGNS_STRING_SIZE];
868 int cellDim, physDim;
869 const int iBase = 1;
870 if (cg_base_read(fn, iBase, cgnsname, &cellDim, &physDim)) cg_error_exit();
871 nDim = physDim;
872
873 if (cellDim != physDim) {
874 ostringstream message;
875 message << "The element dimension, " << cellDim << ", differs from the physical dimension, " << physDim << "."
876 << endl;
877 message << "These should be the same for the DG-FEM solver." << endl;
878
879 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
880 }
881
882 /* Write the info about the number of dimensions. */
883 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
884 if (nDim == 2) cout << "Two dimensional problem." << endl;
885 if (nDim == 3) cout << "Three dimensional problem." << endl;
886 }
887
888 /* Set the zone ID for CGNS, CGNS indices starts at 1, and check
889 if the requested zone ID is a valid one. */
890 const int iZone = val_iZone + 1;
891
892 int nzones;
893 if (cg_nzones(fn, iBase, &nzones) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
894 if (iZone < 1 || iZone > nzones) {
895 ostringstream message;
896 message << "Zone " << iZone << " requested for reading, but there are only " << nzones
897 << " zones present in the CGNS file." << endl;
898
899 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
900 }
901
902 /* Determine the zone type for the requested zone and check if it is
903 unstructured. */
904 ZoneType_t zoneType;
905 if (cg_zone_type(fn, iBase, iZone, &zoneType) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
906 if (zoneType != Unstructured)
907 SU2_MPI::Error("Structured CGNS zone found while unstructured expected.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
908
909 /* Determine the number of sections for the connectivities in this zone. */
910 int nsections;
911 if (cg_nsections(fn, iBase, iZone, &nsections) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
912
913 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
914 /*--- Reading and distributing the volume elements. ---*/
915 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
916
917 /* Loop over the sections to store the meta data in CGNSElemTypes
918 and to determine the number of volume elements.
919 Note that the indices start at 1 in CGNS. */
920 vector<CCGNSElementType> CGNSElemTypes(nsections);
921
922 for (int iConn = 1; iConn <= nsections; ++iConn) {
923 CGNSElemTypes[iConn - 1].DetermineMetaData(nDim, fn, iBase, iZone, iConn);
924 if (CGNSElemTypes[iConn - 1].volumeConn) Global_nElem += CGNSElemTypes[iConn - 1].nElem;
925 }
926
927 if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size > SINGLE_NODE))
928 cout << Global_nElem << " interior elements before parallel partitioning." << endl;
929
930 /*--- Check if the number of cores used is larger than the number of
931 elements. Terminate if this is the case, because it does not make
932 sense to do this. ---*/
933 unsigned long nCores = size; // Correct for the number of cores per rank.
934 if (nCores > Global_nElem) {
935 ostringstream message;
936 message << "The number of cores, " << nCores;
937 message << ", is larger than the number of elements, " << Global_nElem << "." << endl;
938 message << "This is not an efficient use of the resources and therefore "
939 << "SU2 will terminate.";
940
941 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
942 }
943
944 /*--- Compute the number of elements that will be stored on each rank.
945 This is a linear partitioning with the addition of a simple load
946 balancing for any remainder elements. ---*/
947 unsigned long total_elem_accounted = 0;
948 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < (unsigned long)size; i++) {
949 nPointLinear[i] = Global_nElem / size;
950 total_elem_accounted = total_elem_accounted + nPointLinear[i];
951 }
952
953 /*--- Get the number of remainder elements after the even division ---*/
954 const unsigned long rem_elem = Global_nElem - total_elem_accounted;
955 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < rem_elem; i++) {
956 ++nPointLinear[i];
957 }
958
959 /*--- Store the local number of elements and the beginning/end index ---*/
960 nElem = nPointLinear[rank];
961 beg_node[0] = 0;
962 end_node[0] = beg_node[0] + nPointLinear[0];
963 for (int i = 1; i < size; i++) {
964 beg_node[i] = end_node[i - 1];
965 end_node[i] = beg_node[i] + nPointLinear[i];
966 }
967
968 /*--- Allocate space for elements ---*/
969 elem = new CPrimalGrid*[nElem]();
970
971 /*--- Loop over over the connectivities and read the elements to be stored on
972 this rank. Furthermore, determine the local amount of DOFs for the
973 solution (which may differ from the number of DOFS for the grid). ---*/
974 unsigned long nDOFsLoc = 0, elemCount = 0, locElemCount = 0;
975
976 for (int iConn = 0; iConn < nsections; ++iConn) {
977 if (CGNSElemTypes[iConn].volumeConn) {
978 /* Determine the global volume element range for this connectivity. */
979 const unsigned long elemCountOld = elemCount;
980 elemCount += CGNSElemTypes[iConn].nElem;
981
982 /* Check for overlap with the element range this rank is responsible for. */
983 const unsigned long indBegOverlap = max(elemCountOld, beg_node[rank]);
984 const unsigned long indEndOverlap = min(elemCount, end_node[rank]);
985
986 if (indEndOverlap > indBegOverlap) {
987 /* This rank must read element data from this connectivity section.
988 Determine the offset relative to the start of this section and the
989 number of elements to be read by this rank. */
990 const unsigned long offsetRank = indBegOverlap - elemCountOld;
991 const unsigned long nElemRank = indEndOverlap - indBegOverlap;
992
993 /* Read the connectivity range determined above. */
994 CGNSElemTypes[iConn].ReadConnectivityRange(fn, iBase, iZone, offsetRank, nElemRank, beg_node[rank], elem,
995 locElemCount, nDOFsLoc);
996 }
997 }
998 }
999
1000#ifdef HAVE_MPI
1001 /* The global offset of the DOFs must be corrected when running in
1002 parallel. Therefore gather the number of DOFs of all the ranks. */
1003 vector<unsigned long> nDOFsPerRank(size);
1004 SU2_MPI::Allgather(&nDOFsLoc, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, nDOFsPerRank.data(), 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1005
1006 /* Determine the offset for the DOFs on this rank. */
1007 unsigned long offsetRank = 0;
1008 for (int i = 0; i < rank; ++i) offsetRank += nDOFsPerRank[i];
1009
1010 /* Loop over the local elements to correct the global offset of the DOFs. */
1011 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) elem[i]->AddOffsetGlobalDOFs(offsetRank);
1012#endif
1013
1014 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1015 /*--- Reading and distributing the coordinates. ---*/
1016 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1017
1018 /* Determine the global number of vertices in the requested zone.
1019 The other size information is not used. */
1020 cgsize_t sizes[3];
1021 if (cg_zone_read(fn, iBase, iZone, cgnsname, sizes) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
1022 Global_nPoint = sizes[0];
1023
1024 /*--- Determine the number of points per rank in cumulative storage format.
1025 This is done to avoid that every rank reads all the coordinates.
1026 The required coordinates for each rank are later obtained via
1027 communication. ---*/
1028 unsigned long totalPointsAccounted = 0;
1029 vector<cgsize_t> nPointsPerRank(size + 1);
1030 for (int i = 1; i <= size; ++i) {
1031 nPointsPerRank[i] = Global_nPoint / size;
1032 totalPointsAccounted += nPointsPerRank[i];
1033 }
1034
1035 const unsigned long nPointsRem = Global_nPoint - totalPointsAccounted;
1036 for (unsigned long i = 1; i <= nPointsRem; ++i) ++nPointsPerRank[i];
1037
1038 nPointsPerRank[0] = 0;
1039 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) nPointsPerRank[i + 1] += nPointsPerRank[i];
1040
1041 /* Determine the number of points that must be read by this rank and
1042 allocate the memory for the coordinate buffers. */
1043 const cgsize_t nPointsRead = nPointsPerRank[rank + 1] - nPointsPerRank[rank];
1044 vector<vector<su2double> > coorBuf(nDim, vector<su2double>(nPointsRead));
1045
1046 /* Loop over the number of dimensions to read the coordinates. Note that
1047 the loop starts at 1 and ends at nDim because CGNS requires this. */
1048 for (unsigned short iDim = 1; iDim <= nDim; ++iDim) {
1049 /* Determine the data type and name of the coordinate. Copy the name
1050 of the coordinate in a string for easier comparison. */
1051 DataType_t datatype;
1052 if (cg_coord_info(fn, iBase, iZone, iDim, &datatype, cgnsname) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
1053 string coorname = cgnsname;
1054
1055 /* Check the name of the coordinate and determine the index in coorBuf
1056 where to store this coordinate. Normally this should be iDim-1. */
1057 unsigned short indC = 0;
1058 if (coorname == "CoordinateX")
1059 indC = 0;
1060 else if (coorname == "CoordinateY")
1061 indC = 1;
1062 else if (coorname == "CoordinateZ")
1063 indC = 2;
1064 else
1065 SU2_MPI::Error(string("Unknown coordinate name, ") + coorname + string(", encountered in the CGNS file."),
1066 CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1067
1068 /* Easier storage of the range in the CGNS file. */
1069 cgsize_t range_min = nPointsPerRank[rank] + 1;
1070 cgsize_t range_max = nPointsPerRank[rank + 1];
1071
1072 /*--- Read the coordinate with the required precision and copy
1073 this data to the correct index in coorBuf. ---*/
1074 switch (datatype) {
1075 case RealSingle: {
1076 /* Single precision used. */
1077 vector<float> buf(nPointsRead);
1078 if (cg_coord_read(fn, iBase, iZone, cgnsname, datatype, &range_min, &range_max, buf.data()) != CG_OK)
1079 cg_error_exit();
1080
1081 for (cgsize_t i = 0; i < nPointsRead; ++i) coorBuf[indC][i] = buf[i];
1082 break;
1083 }
1084
1085 case RealDouble: {
1086 /* Double precision used. */
1087 vector<double> buf(nPointsRead);
1088 if (cg_coord_read(fn, iBase, iZone, cgnsname, datatype, &range_min, &range_max, buf.data()) != CG_OK)
1089 cg_error_exit();
1090
1091 for (cgsize_t i = 0; i < nPointsRead; ++i) coorBuf[indC][i] = buf[i];
1092 break;
1093 }
1094
1095 default: {
1096 ostringstream message;
1097 message << "Datatype for coordinates must be RealSingle or RealDouble, "
1098 << "not " << datatype << endl;
1099 SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1100 }
1101 }
1102 }
1103
1104 /* Make a distinction between sequential and parallel mode. */
1105#ifdef HAVE_MPI
1106 /*--- Parallel mode. Create a vector, which contains the global
1107 node IDs of the local elements. ---*/
1108 vector<unsigned long> nodeIDsElemLoc;
1109 nodeIDsElemLoc.reserve(nDOFsLoc);
1110 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < locElemCount; ++i) {
1111 unsigned short nDOFsElem = elem[i]->GetnNodes();
1112 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFsElem; ++j) nodeIDsElemLoc.push_back(elem[i]->GetNode(j));
1113 }
1114
1115 sort(nodeIDsElemLoc.begin(), nodeIDsElemLoc.end());
1116 vector<unsigned long>::iterator lastNode;
1117 lastNode = unique(nodeIDsElemLoc.begin(), nodeIDsElemLoc.end());
1118 nodeIDsElemLoc.erase(lastNode, nodeIDsElemLoc.end());
1119
1120 /*--- Allocate the memory for the coordinates to be stored on this rank. ---*/
1121 nPoint = nodeIDsElemLoc.size();
1122 nodes = new CPoint(nPoint, nDim);
1123
1124 /*--- Store the global ID's of the nodes in such a way that they can
1125 be sent to the rank that actually stores the coordinates.. ---*/
1126 vector<vector<unsigned long> > nodeBuf(size, vector<unsigned long>(0));
1127 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nodeIDsElemLoc.size(); ++i) {
1128 const cgsize_t nodeID = nodeIDsElemLoc[i];
1129 vector<cgsize_t>::iterator low;
1130 low = lower_bound(nPointsPerRank.begin(), nPointsPerRank.end(), nodeID);
1131 cgsize_t rankNode = low - nPointsPerRank.begin();
1132 if (*low > nodeID) --rankNode;
1133
1134 nodeBuf[rankNode].push_back(nodeIDsElemLoc[i]);
1135 }
1136
1137 /*--- Determine the total number of ranks to which this rank will send
1138 a message and also determine the number of ranks from which this
1139 rank will receive a message. Furthermore, determine the starting
1140 indices where data from the different ranks should be stored in
1141 node. ---*/
1142 int nRankSend = 0;
1143 vector<int> sendToRank(size, 0);
1144 vector<unsigned long> startingIndRanksInNode(size + 1);
1145 startingIndRanksInNode[0] = 0;
1146
1147 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1148 startingIndRanksInNode[i + 1] = startingIndRanksInNode[i] + nodeBuf[i].size();
1149
1150 if (!nodeBuf[i].empty()) {
1151 ++nRankSend;
1152 sendToRank[i] = 1;
1153 }
1154 }
1155
1156 int nRankRecv;
1157 vector<int> sizeRecv(size, 1);
1158 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1159
1160 /*--- Send out the messages with the global node numbers. Use nonblocking
1161 sends to avoid deadlock. ---*/
1162 vector<SU2_MPI::Request> sendReqs(nRankSend);
1163 nRankSend = 0;
1164 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1165 if (!nodeBuf[i].empty()) {
1166 SU2_MPI::Isend(nodeBuf[i].data(), nodeBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1167 &sendReqs[nRankSend]);
1168 ++nRankSend;
1169 }
1170 }
1171
1172 /* Define the communication buffer for the coordinates and the vector
1173 for the return communication requests. */
1174 vector<SU2_MPI::Request> returnReqs(nRankRecv);
1175 vector<vector<su2double> > coorReturnBuf(nRankRecv, vector<su2double>(0));
1176
1177 /*--- Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank receives global
1178 point numbers that should be stored on this rank. ---*/
1179 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1180 /* Block until a message arrives. Determine the source and size
1181 of the message. */
1182 SU2_MPI::Status status;
1183 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1184 int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1185
1186 int sizeMess;
1187 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
1188
1189 /* Allocate the memory for a buffer to receive this message and also
1190 for the buffer to return to coordinates. */
1191 vector<unsigned long> nodeRecvBuf(sizeMess);
1192 coorReturnBuf[i].resize(nDim * sizeMess);
1193
1194 /* Receive the message using a blocking receive. */
1195 SU2_MPI::Recv(nodeRecvBuf.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1196
1197 /*--- Loop over the nodes just received and fill the return communication
1198 buffer with the coordinates of the requested nodes. ---*/
1199 for (int j = 0; j < sizeMess; ++j) {
1200 const int jj = nDim * j;
1201 const long kk = nodeRecvBuf[j] - nPointsPerRank[rank];
1202 if (kk < 0 || kk >= nPointsRead)
1203 SU2_MPI::Error("Invalid point requested. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1204
1205 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDim; ++k) coorReturnBuf[i][jj + k] = coorBuf[k][kk];
1206 }
1207
1208 /* Send the buffer just filled back to the requesting rank.
1209 Use a non-blocking send to avoid deadlock. */
1210 SU2_MPI::Isend(coorReturnBuf[i].data(), coorReturnBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE, source, source + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1211 &returnReqs[i]);
1212 }
1213
1214 /* Loop over the ranks from which this rank has requested coordinates. */
1215 for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
1216 /* Block until a message arrives. Determine the source of the message. */
1217 SU2_MPI::Status status;
1218 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1219 int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1220
1221 /* Allocate the memory for the coordinate receive buffer. */
1222 vector<su2double> coorRecvBuf(nDim * nodeBuf[source].size());
1223
1224 /* Receive the message using a blocking receive. */
1225 SU2_MPI::Recv(coorRecvBuf.data(), coorRecvBuf.size(), MPI_DOUBLE, source, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1226
1227 /*--- Make a distinction between 2D and 3D to store the data of the nodes.
1228 This data is created by taking the offset of the source rank into
1229 account. In this way the nodes are numbered with increading
1230 global node ID. ---*/
1231 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nodeBuf[source].size(); ++j) {
1232 const unsigned long jj = nDim * j;
1233 const unsigned long kk = startingIndRanksInNode[source] + j;
1234
1235 nodes->SetCoord(kk, &coorRecvBuf[jj]);
1236 nodes->SetGlobalIndex(kk, nodeBuf[source][j]);
1237 }
1238 }
1239
1240 /* Complete the non-blocking sends of both rounds. */
1241 SU2_MPI::Waitall(sendReqs.size(), sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1242 SU2_MPI::Waitall(returnReqs.size(), returnReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1243
1244 /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
1245 so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
1246 SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1247
1248#else
1249 /*--- Sequential mode. Create the data for the points. The global
1250 number of points equals the local number of points. ---*/
1251 nPoint = Global_nPoint;
1252 nodes = new CPoint(nPoint, nDim);
1253
1254 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nPoint; ++i) {
1255 for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) nodes->SetCoord(i, iDim, coorBuf[iDim][i]);
1256 nodes->SetGlobalIndex(i, i);
1257 }
1258
1259#endif
1260
1261 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1262 /*--- Determine and distribute the single faces of the elements. These ---*/
1263 /*--- faces are distributed over the ranks such that later the boundary ---*/
1264 /*--- can retrieve the info on which rank they must be stored without ---*/
1265 /*--- each rank having to read the entire connectivity data. ---*/
1266 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1267
1268 /*--- Determine the faces of the local elements. --- */
1269 vector<CFaceOfElement> localFaces;
1270 for (unsigned long k = 0; k < nElem; ++k) {
1271 /*--- Get the global IDs of the corner points of all the faces of this elements. ---*/
1272 unsigned short nFaces;
1273 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
1274 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
1275
1276 elem[k]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
1277
1278 /*--- Loop over the faces and add them to localFaces. For consistency
1279 between sequential and parallel mode the rank is stored at the
1280 position for the second element ID. ---*/
1281 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nFaces; ++i) {
1282 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
1283 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[i];
1284 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[i][j];
1285 thisFace.elemID0 = k + beg_node[rank];
1286 thisFace.elemID1 = rank;
1287
1288 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
1289 localFaces.push_back(thisFace);
1290 }
1291 }
1292
1293 /*--- Sort localFaces in increasing order and remove the double entities,
1294 such that unnecessary data is not communicated later on. ---*/
1295 sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
1296 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator lastFace;
1297 lastFace = unique(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
1298 localFaces.erase(lastFace, localFaces.end());
1299
1300#ifdef HAVE_MPI
1301
1302 /*--- In parallel mode these faces must be distributed over the ranks.
1303 A face is stored on the rank where its first node ID is located
1304 based on nPointsPerRank. Define the communication buffers and
1305 determine their contents. ---*/
1306 vector<vector<unsigned long> > faceBuf(size, vector<unsigned long>(0));
1307 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < localFaces.size(); ++i) {
1308 const cgsize_t nodeID = localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0];
1309 vector<cgsize_t>::iterator low;
1310 low = lower_bound(nPointsPerRank.begin(), nPointsPerRank.end(), nodeID);
1311 cgsize_t rankNode = low - nPointsPerRank.begin();
1312 if (*low > nodeID) --rankNode;
1313
1314 faceBuf[rankNode].push_back(localFaces[i].nCornerPoints);
1315 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < localFaces[i].nCornerPoints; ++j)
1316 faceBuf[rankNode].push_back(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[j]);
1317 faceBuf[rankNode].push_back(localFaces[i].elemID0);
1318 }
1319
1320 /* Delete the memory of localFaces again, because its contents will be
1321 build from the messages that this rank will receive. */
1322 localFaces.clear();
1323
1324 /*--- Determine the number of messages this rank will send and receive. ---*/
1325 nRankSend = 0;
1326 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1327 if (!faceBuf[i].empty()) {
1328 ++nRankSend;
1329 sendToRank[i] = 1;
1330 } else {
1331 sendToRank[i] = 0;
1332 }
1333 }
1334
1335 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1336
1337 /*--- Send the messages using non-blocking sends to avoid deadlock. ---*/
1338 sendReqs.resize(nRankSend);
1339 nRankSend = 0;
1340 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1341 if (!faceBuf[i].empty()) {
1342 SU2_MPI::Isend(faceBuf[i].data(), faceBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i + 4, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1343 &sendReqs[nRankSend]);
1344 ++nRankSend;
1345 }
1346 }
1347
1348 /* Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank will receive data. */
1349 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1350 /* Block until a message arrives and determine the source and size
1351 of the message. */
1352 SU2_MPI::Status status;
1353 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank + 4, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1354 int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1355
1356 int sizeMess;
1357 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
1358
1359 /* Allocate the memory for the receive buffer and receive the
1360 message using a non-blocking receive. */
1361 vector<unsigned long> faceRecvBuf(sizeMess);
1362 SU2_MPI::Recv(faceRecvBuf.data(), faceRecvBuf.size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, rank + 4, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1363 &status);
1364
1365 /* Loop to extract the data from the receive buffer. */
1366 int ii = 0;
1367 while (ii < sizeMess) {
1368 /* Store the data for this face in localFaces. The rank where the
1369 corresponding element is physically present is stored in the
1370 second element ID. Note that it is not necessary to create a unique
1371 numbering anymore, because this has already been done before the
1372 communication buffer was created. */
1373 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
1374 thisFace.nCornerPoints = (unsigned short)faceRecvBuf[ii++];
1375 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < thisFace.nCornerPoints; ++j, ++ii) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceRecvBuf[ii];
1376 thisFace.elemID0 = faceRecvBuf[ii++];
1377
1378 thisFace.elemID1 = source;
1379 localFaces.push_back(thisFace);
1380 }
1381 }
1382
1383 /*--- Sort localFaces in increasing order and remove the double entities,
1384 such that searching is a bit more efficient later on. ---*/
1385 sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
1386 lastFace = unique(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
1387 localFaces.erase(lastFace, localFaces.end());
1388
1389 /* Complete the non-blocking sends. Afterwards, synchronize the ranks,
1390 because wild cards have been used. */
1391 SU2_MPI::Waitall(sendReqs.size(), sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1392 SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1393
1394#endif
1395
1396 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1397 /*--- Reading and distributing the surface elements. ---*/
1398 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1399
1400 /* Determine the number of families in this base and read their names.
1401 Note that when multiple zones are present, this step is repeated for
1402 every zone. */
1403 int nFamilies;
1404 if (cg_nfamilies(fn, iBase, &nFamilies) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
1405
1406 vector<string> familyNames(nFamilies);
1407 for (int i = 1; i <= nFamilies; ++i) {
1408 int nFamBC, nGeo;
1409 if (cg_family_read(fn, iBase, i, cgnsname, &nFamBC, &nGeo) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
1410 familyNames[i - 1] = cgnsname;
1411 }
1412
1413 /* Determine the number of boundary conditions for this zone. */
1414 int nBCs;
1415 if (cg_nbocos(fn, iBase, iZone, &nBCs) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
1416
1417 /* Read the names of the boundary conditions and determine their family names.
1418 If not family name is specified for a boundary condition, the family name
1419 is set to the name of the boundary condition. */
1420 vector<string> BCNames(nBCs), BCFamilyNames(nBCs);
1421 for (int i = 1; i <= nBCs; ++i) {
1422 /* Read the info for this boundary condition. */
1423 BCType_t BCType;
1424 PointSetType_t ptsetType;
1425 cgsize_t npnts, NormalListSize;
1426 int NormalIndex, nDataSet;
1427 DataType_t NormalDataType;
1428 if (cg_boco_info(fn, iBase, iZone, i, cgnsname, &BCType, &ptsetType, &npnts, &NormalIndex, &NormalListSize,
1429 &NormalDataType, &nDataSet) != CG_OK)
1430 cg_error_exit();
1431 BCNames[i - 1] = cgnsname;
1432
1433 /* Read the possibly family name and set it. If not present, it is
1434 equal to BCName. */
1435 if (cg_goto(fn, iBase, "Zone_t", iZone, "ZoneBC_t", 1, "BC_t", i, "end") != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
1436
1437 int ierr = cg_famname_read(cgnsname);
1438 if (ierr == CG_ERROR)
1439 cg_error_exit();
1440 else if (ierr == CG_OK)
1441 BCFamilyNames[i - 1] = cgnsname;
1442 else
1443 BCFamilyNames[i - 1] = BCNames[i - 1];
1444 }
1445
1446 /*--- Determine the number of different surface connectivities. It is
1447 possible to specify a family name for a surface connectivity. If that
1448 family name is the same for multiple surface connectivities, these
1449 connectivities are merged together for the boundary condition
1450 treatment in the DG-FEM solver. ---*/
1451 vector<string> surfaceNames;
1452 vector<vector<int> > surfaceConnIDs;
1453
1454 for (int i = 0; i < nsections; ++i) {
1455 if (CGNSElemTypes[i].surfaceConn) {
1456 /*--- Determine the surface name to use for this connectivity.
1457 This name is determined as follows (in terms of importance).
1458 1) Family name specified for this connectivity.
1459 2) Family name of the corresponding boundary condition,
1460 if present.
1461 3) Name of the connectivity. ---*/
1462 string thisSurfaceName;
1463 const int connID = CGNSElemTypes[i].connID;
1464
1465 /* First try to read the family name for the connectivity. */
1466 if (cg_goto(fn, iBase, "Zone_t", iZone, "Elements_t", connID, "end") != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
1467 int ierr = cg_famname_read(cgnsname);
1468 if (ierr == CG_ERROR)
1469 cg_error_exit();
1470 else if (ierr == CG_OK)
1471 thisSurfaceName = cgnsname;
1472 else {
1473 /* No family name. Check the boundary conditions. It is assumed that
1474 the boundary conditions have the same name as the connectivities. */
1475 int j;
1476 for (j = 0; j < nBCs; ++j) {
1477 if (BCNames[j] == CGNSElemTypes[i].connName) {
1478 thisSurfaceName = BCFamilyNames[j];
1479 break;
1480 }
1481 }
1482
1483 /* If the name is not found in the boundary conditions, set the name
1484 of this surface connectivity to the name of this connectivity. */
1485 if (j == nBCs) thisSurfaceName = CGNSElemTypes[i].connName;
1486 }
1487
1488 /* Loop over the previously stored surface names and check if this
1489 surface name is already present. */
1490 unsigned long j;
1491 for (j = 0; j < surfaceNames.size(); ++j) {
1492 if (thisSurfaceName == surfaceNames[j]) {
1493 surfaceConnIDs[j].push_back(i);
1494 }
1495 }
1496
1497 /* If the surface name is not stored yet, create new entries in
1498 surfaceNames and surfaceConnIDs. */
1499 if (j == surfaceNames.size()) {
1500 surfaceNames.push_back(thisSurfaceName);
1501 vector<int> thisSurfaceConn(1, i);
1502 surfaceConnIDs.push_back(thisSurfaceConn);
1503 }
1504 }
1505 }
1506
1507 /* Write a message about the number of surface markers and allocate the
1508 memory for the data structures to store the required information. */
1509 nMarker = surfaceNames.size();
1510 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) cout << nMarker << " surface markers." << endl;
1511 config->SetnMarker_All(nMarker);
1512
1513 unsigned short nMarker_Max = config->GetnMarker_Max();
1514
1515 bound = new CPrimalGrid**[nMarker];
1516 nElem_Bound = new unsigned long[nMarker];
1517 Tag_to_Marker = new string[nMarker_Max];
1518
1519 /* Loop over the number of markers to read and distribute the connectivities. */
1520 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1521 /* Easier storage of the entries in CGNSElemTypes that contribute
1522 to this boundary marker. */
1523 const int nEntries = surfaceConnIDs[iMarker].size();
1524 const int* entries = surfaceConnIDs[iMarker].data();
1525
1526 /* Determine the global number of elements for this boundary marker. */
1527 cgsize_t nElem_Bound_Global = 0;
1528 for (int iConn = 0; iConn < nEntries; ++iConn) nElem_Bound_Global += CGNSElemTypes[entries[iConn]].nElem;
1529
1530 /* Write a message about the global number of surface elements
1531 present in this marker. */
1532 string Marker_Tag = surfaceNames[iMarker];
1533 if (rank == MASTER_NODE)
1534 cout << nElem_Bound_Global << " boundary elements in index " << iMarker << " (Marker = " << Marker_Tag << ")."
1535 << endl;
1536
1537 /* Determine the number of surface elements per rank in cumulative storage
1538 format. This is done to avoid that every rank reads all the elements.
1539 This is to avoid that every rank reads all the elements. The correct
1540 rank for storage is determined later via communication. */
1541 unsigned long totalBoundElemAccounted = 0;
1542 vector<unsigned long> nBoundElemPerRank(size + 1);
1543 for (int i = 1; i <= size; ++i) {
1544 nBoundElemPerRank[i] = nElem_Bound_Global / size;
1545 totalBoundElemAccounted += nBoundElemPerRank[i];
1546 }
1547
1548 const unsigned long nBoundElemRem = nElem_Bound_Global - totalBoundElemAccounted;
1549 for (unsigned long i = 1; i <= nBoundElemRem; ++i) ++nBoundElemPerRank[i];
1550
1551 nBoundElemPerRank[0] = 0;
1552 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) nBoundElemPerRank[i + 1] += nBoundElemPerRank[i];
1553
1554 /* Define a vector of FEM boundary elements to store the local
1555 boundary faces to be read. */
1556 vector<CBoundaryFace> boundElems;
1557
1558 /* Loop over the connectivity sections that contribute. */
1559 elemCount = locElemCount = 0;
1560 for (int iConn = 0; iConn < nEntries; ++iConn) {
1561 /* Determine the global range for this connectivity. */
1562 const unsigned long elemCountOld = elemCount;
1563 elemCount += CGNSElemTypes[entries[iConn]].nElem;
1564
1565 /* Check for overlap with the element range this rank is responsible for. */
1566 const unsigned long indBegOverlap = max(elemCountOld, nBoundElemPerRank[rank]);
1567 const unsigned long indEndOverlap = min(elemCount, nBoundElemPerRank[rank + 1]);
1568
1569 if (indEndOverlap > indBegOverlap) {
1570 /* This rank must read boundary element data from this connectivity
1571 section. Determine the offset relative to the start of this section
1572 and the number of elements to be read by this rank. */
1573 const unsigned long offsetRank = indBegOverlap - elemCountOld;
1574 const unsigned long nElemRank = indEndOverlap - indBegOverlap;
1575
1576 /* Read the connectivity range determined above. */
1577 CGNSElemTypes[entries[iConn]].ReadBoundaryConnectivityRange(fn, iBase, iZone, offsetRank, nElemRank,
1578 nBoundElemPerRank[rank], locElemCount, boundElems);
1579 }
1580 }
1581
1582 /* Make a distinction between sequential and parallel mode. */
1583#ifdef HAVE_MPI
1584 /*--- Parallel mode. The information stored in boundElems must be
1585 communicated to find out where it must be stored. First clear the
1586 contents of the faceBuf, such that it can be used again to send
1587 data to the appropiate rank. ---*/
1588 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) faceBuf[i].clear();
1589
1590 /*-- Loop over the locally read boundary elements and store its contents
1591 in the appropiate location in faceBuf. ---*/
1592 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < boundElems.size(); ++i) {
1593 /* Create an object of the class CFaceOfElement to determine the
1594 node number that determines on which rank the corresponding face
1595 in localFaces is stored. */
1596 CFaceOfElement thisFace(boundElems[i].VTK_Type, boundElems[i].nPolyGrid, boundElems[i].Nodes.data());
1597 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
1598
1599 /* Determine the rank to which this face must be sent to. */
1600 const cgsize_t nodeID = thisFace.cornerPoints[0];
1601 vector<cgsize_t>::iterator low;
1602 low = lower_bound(nPointsPerRank.begin(), nPointsPerRank.end(), nodeID);
1603 cgsize_t rankNode = low - nPointsPerRank.begin();
1604 if (*low > nodeID) --rankNode;
1605
1606 /*--- Copy the relevant data of this boundary element into faceBuf. ---*/
1607 faceBuf[rankNode].push_back(boundElems[i].VTK_Type);
1608 faceBuf[rankNode].push_back(boundElems[i].nPolyGrid);
1609 faceBuf[rankNode].push_back(boundElems[i].nDOFsGrid);
1610 faceBuf[rankNode].push_back(boundElems[i].globalBoundElemID);
1611 faceBuf[rankNode].insert(faceBuf[rankNode].end(), boundElems[i].Nodes.begin(), boundElems[i].Nodes.end());
1612 }
1613
1614 /* The contents of boundElems is copied into faceBuf, so it can
1615 be released. */
1616 boundElems.clear();
1617
1618 /*--- Determine the number of messages this rank will send and receive. ---*/
1619 nRankSend = 0;
1620 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1621 if (!faceBuf[i].empty()) {
1622 ++nRankSend;
1623 sendToRank[i] = 1;
1624 } else {
1625 sendToRank[i] = 0;
1626 }
1627 }
1628
1629 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1630
1631 /*--- Send the messages using non-blocking sends to avoid deadlock. ---*/
1632 sendReqs.resize(nRankSend);
1633 nRankSend = 0;
1634 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1635 if (!faceBuf[i].empty()) {
1636 SU2_MPI::Isend(faceBuf[i].data(), faceBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i + 5, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1637 &sendReqs[nRankSend]);
1638 ++nRankSend;
1639 }
1640 }
1641
1642 /* Use nodeBuf as storage for the sending of the surface element data
1643 to the correct rank. First clear its contents. */
1644 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) nodeBuf[i].clear();
1645
1646 /*--- Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank receives
1647 surface elements to be processed. ---*/
1648 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1649 /* Block until a message arrives. Determine the source and size
1650 of the message. */
1651 SU2_MPI::Status status;
1652 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank + 5, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1653 int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1654
1655 int sizeMess;
1656 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
1657
1658 /* Allocate the memory for the receive buffer and receive the message
1659 using a blocking send. */
1660 vector<unsigned long> boundElemRecvBuf(sizeMess);
1661 SU2_MPI::Recv(boundElemRecvBuf.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, rank + 5, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1662 &status);
1663
1664 /* Loop to extract the data from the receive buffer. */
1665 int ii = 0;
1666 while (ii < sizeMess) {
1667 /* Store the data for this boundary element. */
1668 const auto VTK_Type = (unsigned short)boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1669 const auto nPolyGrid = (unsigned short)boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1670 const auto nDOFsGrid = (unsigned short)boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1671
1672 const unsigned long globalBoundElemID = boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1673 const unsigned long* Nodes = boundElemRecvBuf.data() + ii;
1674 ii += nDOFsGrid;
1675
1676 /* Determine the corner nodes and store them in an object of
1677 the class CFaceOfElement to carry out the search in localFaces. */
1678 CFaceOfElement thisFace(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, Nodes);
1679
1680 /* Check if the face is actually present. If not, print an error message
1681 and exit. */
1682 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
1683 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
1684 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
1685
1686 bool thisFaceFound = false;
1687 if (low != localFaces.end()) {
1688 if (!(thisFace < *low)) thisFaceFound = true;
1689 }
1690
1691 if (!thisFaceFound)
1692 SU2_MPI::Error("Boundary element not found in list of faces. This is a bug.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1693
1694 /* Determine the domain element and the rank where
1695 this boundary element should be sent to.. */
1696 const unsigned long domainElementID = low->elemID0;
1697 const int rankBoundElem = (int)low->elemID1;
1698
1699 /*--- Store the data for this element in the communication buffer
1700 for rankBoundElem. ---*/
1701 nodeBuf[rankBoundElem].push_back(VTK_Type);
1702 nodeBuf[rankBoundElem].push_back(nPolyGrid);
1703 nodeBuf[rankBoundElem].push_back(nDOFsGrid);
1704 nodeBuf[rankBoundElem].push_back(globalBoundElemID);
1705 nodeBuf[rankBoundElem].push_back(domainElementID);
1706
1707 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFsGrid; ++j) nodeBuf[rankBoundElem].push_back(Nodes[j]);
1708 }
1709 }
1710
1711 /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
1712 SU2_MPI::Waitall(sendReqs.size(), sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1713
1714 /*--- Determine the number of messages this rank will send and receive. ---*/
1715 nRankSend = 0;
1716 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1717 if (!nodeBuf[i].empty()) {
1718 ++nRankSend;
1719 sendToRank[i] = 1;
1720 } else {
1721 sendToRank[i] = 0;
1722 }
1723 }
1724
1725 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1726
1727 /*--- Send the messages using non-blocking sends to avoid deadlock. ---*/
1728 sendReqs.resize(nRankSend);
1729 nRankSend = 0;
1730 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1731 if (!nodeBuf[i].empty()) {
1732 SU2_MPI::Isend(nodeBuf[i].data(), nodeBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i + 6, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1733 &sendReqs[nRankSend]);
1734 ++nRankSend;
1735 }
1736 }
1737
1738 /*--- Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank receives
1739 surface elements to be stored on this rank. ---*/
1740 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1741 /* Block until a message arrives. Determine the source and size
1742 of the message. */
1743 SU2_MPI::Status status;
1744 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank + 6, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1745 int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1746
1747 int sizeMess;
1748 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
1749
1750 /* Allocate the memory for the receive buffer and receive the message
1751 using a blocking send. */
1752 vector<unsigned long> boundElemRecvBuf(sizeMess);
1753 SU2_MPI::Recv(boundElemRecvBuf.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, rank + 6, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1754 &status);
1755
1756 /* Loop to extract the data from the receive buffer. */
1757 int ii = 0;
1758 while (ii < sizeMess) {
1759 /* Store the data for this boundary element. */
1760 const auto VTK_Type = (unsigned short)boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1761 const auto nPolyGrid = (unsigned short)boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1762 const auto nDOFsGrid = (unsigned short)boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1763
1764 const unsigned long globalBoundElemID = boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1765 const unsigned long domainElementID = boundElemRecvBuf[ii++];
1766 const unsigned long* Nodes = boundElemRecvBuf.data() + ii;
1767 ii += nDOFsGrid;
1768
1769 /* Create an object of CBoundaryFace and store it in boundElems. */
1770 CBoundaryFace thisBoundFace;
1771 thisBoundFace.VTK_Type = VTK_Type;
1772 thisBoundFace.nPolyGrid = nPolyGrid;
1773 thisBoundFace.nDOFsGrid = nDOFsGrid;
1774 thisBoundFace.globalBoundElemID = globalBoundElemID;
1775 thisBoundFace.domainElementID = domainElementID;
1776
1777 thisBoundFace.Nodes.resize(nDOFsGrid);
1778 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFsGrid; ++j) thisBoundFace.Nodes[j] = Nodes[j];
1779
1780 boundElems.push_back(thisBoundFace);
1781 }
1782 }
1783
1784 /* Sort boundElems in increasing order, where the less than operator
1785 is a comparison between the globalBoundElemID's. */
1786 sort(boundElems.begin(), boundElems.end());
1787
1788 /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the processors,
1789 because wild cards have been used. */
1790 SU2_MPI::Waitall(sendReqs.size(), sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1791
1792 SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1793
1794#else
1795 /*--- Sequential mode. All boundary elements read must be stored on this
1796 rank. The only information missing is the global ID of the domain
1797 element of the boundary elements. This is created below. ---*/
1798 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < boundElems.size(); ++i) {
1799 /* Determine the corner nodes and store them in an object of
1800 the class CFaceOfElement to carry out the search in localFaces. */
1801 CFaceOfElement thisFace(boundElems[i].VTK_Type, boundElems[i].nPolyGrid, boundElems[i].Nodes.data());
1802
1803 /* Check if the face is actually present. If not, print an error message
1804 and exit. */
1805 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
1806 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
1807 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
1808
1809 bool thisFaceFound = false;
1810 if (low != localFaces.end()) {
1811 if (!(thisFace < *low)) thisFaceFound = true;
1812 }
1813
1814 if (!thisFaceFound)
1815 SU2_MPI::Error("Boundary element not found in list of faces. This is a bug.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1816
1817 /* Set the domain element. */
1818 boundElems[i].domainElementID = low->elemID0;
1819 }
1820#endif
1821
1822 /*--- Allocate space for the local boundary elements and copy the data
1823 from boundElems into bound. ---*/
1824 nElem_Bound[iMarker] = boundElems.size();
1825 bound[iMarker] = new CPrimalGrid*[nElem_Bound[iMarker]];
1826
1827 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++i)
1828 bound[iMarker][i] = new CPrimalGridBoundFEM(boundElems[i].globalBoundElemID, boundElems[i].domainElementID,
1829 boundElems[i].VTK_Type, boundElems[i].nPolyGrid,
1830 boundElems[i].nDOFsGrid, boundElems[i].Nodes);
1831
1832 /*--- Update config information storing the boundary information in the right place ---*/
1833 Tag_to_Marker[config->GetMarker_CfgFile_TagBound(Marker_Tag)] = Marker_Tag;
1834 config->SetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker, Marker_Tag);
1835 config->SetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_KindBC(Marker_Tag));
1836 config->SetMarker_All_Monitoring(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Monitoring(Marker_Tag));
1837 config->SetMarker_All_GeoEval(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_GeoEval(Marker_Tag));
1838 config->SetMarker_All_Designing(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Designing(Marker_Tag));
1839 config->SetMarker_All_Plotting(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Plotting(Marker_Tag));
1840 config->SetMarker_All_Analyze(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Analyze(Marker_Tag));
1841 config->SetMarker_All_ZoneInterface(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_ZoneInterface(Marker_Tag));
1842 config->SetMarker_All_DV(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_DV(Marker_Tag));
1843 config->SetMarker_All_Moving(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_Moving(Marker_Tag));
1844 config->SetMarker_All_SobolevBC(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_SobolevBC(Marker_Tag));
1845 config->SetMarker_All_PerBound(iMarker, config->GetMarker_CfgFile_PerBound(Marker_Tag));
1846 config->SetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker, NONE);
1847 }
1848
1849 /* Close the CGNS file again. */
1850 if (cg_close(fn) != CG_OK) cg_error_exit();
1851 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) cout << "Successfully closed the CGNS file." << endl;
1852
1853#else /* CGNS_VERSION >= 3300 */
1854
1855 SU2_MPI::Error("CGNS version 3.3 or higher is necessary for the DG FEM solver", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1856
1857#endif /* CGNS_VERSION >= 3300 */
1858
1859#else /* HAVE_CGNS. */
1860
1861 SU2_MPI::Error("SU2 built without CGNS support!!\nTo use CGNS, build SU2 accordingly.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1862
1863#endif /* HAVE_CGNS. */
1864}
1865
1866void CPhysicalGeometry::SetColorFEMGrid_Parallel(CConfig* config) {
1867 /*--- Initialize the color vector of the elements. ---*/
1868 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) elem[i]->SetColor(0);
1869
1870 /*--- Determine the faces of the elements. ---*/
1871 vector<CFaceOfElement> localFaces;
1872 for (unsigned long k = 0; k < nElem; k++) {
1873 /*--- Get the global IDs of the corner points of all the faces of this element. ---*/
1874 unsigned short nFaces;
1875 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
1876 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
1877
1878 elem[k]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
1879
1880 /*--- Loop over the faces and add them to localFaces. ---*/
1881 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nFaces; ++i) {
1882 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
1883 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[i];
1884 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[i][j];
1885 thisFace.elemID0 = beg_node[rank] + k;
1886 thisFace.nPolySol0 = elem[k]->GetNPolySol();
1887 thisFace.nDOFsElem0 = elem[k]->GetNDOFsSol();
1888 thisFace.elemType0 = elem[k]->GetVTK_Type();
1889
1890 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
1891 localFaces.push_back(thisFace);
1892 }
1893 }
1894
1895 /*--- Sort localFaces in increasing order. */
1896 sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
1897
1898 /*--- Loop over the boundary markers and its faces in order to flag the
1899 physical boundary faces in localFaces. Note that use is made of the
1900 overloaded function GetCornerPointsAllFaces, which explains the
1901 dimensions of the variables used in the function call. Also note that
1902 the periodic boundaries are excluded, because they are not physical. ---*/
1903 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1904 if (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) != PERIODIC_BOUNDARY) {
1905 for (unsigned long k = 0; k < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++k) {
1906 unsigned short nFaces;
1907 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
1908 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
1909 bound[iMarker][k]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
1910
1911 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
1912 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[0];
1913 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[0]; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[0][j];
1914 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
1915
1916 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
1917 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
1918
1919 /*--- Store the corresponding element ID for the boundary element and
1920 invalidate the face by setting the element ID to an invalid value. ---*/
1921 bound[iMarker][k]->SetDomainElement(low->elemID0);
1922 low->elemID0 = Global_nElem + 10;
1923 }
1924 }
1925 }
1926
1927 /*--- Loop over the faces and check for double entries. If a double entry is
1928 found, the elemID from the second entry is copied to the first entry,
1929 the polynomial degree is updated, and the second entry is invalidated. ---*/
1930 unsigned long nFacesLoc = localFaces.size();
1931 for (unsigned long i = 1; i < nFacesLoc; ++i) {
1932 if (localFaces[i] == localFaces[i - 1]) {
1933 localFaces[i - 1].elemID1 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
1934 localFaces[i - 1].nPolySol1 = localFaces[i].nPolySol0;
1935 localFaces[i - 1].nDOFsElem1 = localFaces[i].nDOFsElem0;
1936 localFaces[i - 1].elemType1 = localFaces[i].elemType0;
1937 localFaces[i].elemID0 = Global_nElem + 10;
1938 }
1939 }
1940
1941 /*--- Remove the invalidated faces. This is accomplished by giving the
1942 face four points a global node ID that is larger than the largest
1943 point ID in the grid. In this way the sorting operator puts
1944 these faces at the end of the vector, see also the < operator
1945 of CFaceOfElement. ---*/
1946 unsigned long nFacesLocOr = nFacesLoc;
1947 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nFacesLocOr; ++i) {
1948 if (localFaces[i].elemID0 > Global_nElem) {
1949 localFaces[i].nCornerPoints = 4;
1950 localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = Global_nPoint;
1951 localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = Global_nPoint;
1952 localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = Global_nPoint;
1953 localFaces[i].cornerPoints[3] = Global_nPoint;
1954 --nFacesLoc;
1955 }
1956 }
1957
1958 sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
1959 localFaces.resize(nFacesLoc);
1960
1961 /*--- The following part of this function should only be present if we have
1962 parallel support with MPI. ---*/
1963
1964#ifdef HAVE_MPI
1965
1966 /*--- Determine and store the faces, for which only one neighboring element
1967 was found. For these faces the other neighbor might be stored on
1968 a different rank (unless there are non-matching interfaces). ---*/
1969 vector<CFaceOfElement> localFacesComm;
1970 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nFacesLoc; ++i)
1971 if (localFaces[i].elemID1 > Global_nElem) localFacesComm.push_back(localFaces[i]);
1972
1973 /*--- Determine the maximum global point ID that occurs in localFacesComm
1974 of all ranks. Note that only the first point is taken into account,
1975 because this point determines the rank where the face is sent to. ---*/
1976 unsigned long nFacesLocComm = localFacesComm.size();
1977 unsigned long maxPointIDLoc = 0;
1978 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nFacesLocComm; ++i)
1979 maxPointIDLoc = max(maxPointIDLoc, localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[0]);
1980
1981 unsigned long maxPointID;
1982 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&maxPointIDLoc, &maxPointID, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_MAX, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1983 ++maxPointID;
1984
1985 /*--- Create a vector with a linear distribution over the ranks for
1986 the points that occur in the faces of localFacesComm. ---*/
1987 vector<unsigned long> facePointsProc(size + 1, 0);
1988 unsigned long total_point_accounted = 0;
1989 for (unsigned long i = 1; i <= (unsigned long)size; ++i) {
1990 facePointsProc[i] = maxPointID / size;
1991 total_point_accounted += facePointsProc[i];
1992 }
1993
1994 unsigned long rem_point = maxPointID - total_point_accounted;
1995 for (unsigned long i = 1; i <= rem_point; ++i) ++facePointsProc[i];
1996
1997 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < (unsigned long)size; ++i) facePointsProc[i + 1] += facePointsProc[i];
1998
1999 /*--- Determine the number of faces that has to be sent to each rank.
2000 Note that the rank is stored in elemID1, such that the search
2001 does not have to be repeated below. ---*/
2002 vector<unsigned long> nFacesComm(size, 0);
2003 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nFacesLocComm; ++i) {
2004 vector<unsigned long>::iterator low;
2005 low = lower_bound(facePointsProc.begin(), facePointsProc.end(), localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[0]);
2006 unsigned long rankFace = low - facePointsProc.begin();
2007 if (*low > localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[0]) --rankFace;
2008
2009 ++nFacesComm[rankFace];
2010 localFacesComm[i].elemID1 = rankFace;
2011 }
2012
2013 /*--- Create the send buffer for the faces to be communicated. ---*/
2014 vector<unsigned long> sendBufFace(9 * nFacesLocComm);
2015 vector<unsigned long> counter(size);
2016 counter[0] = 0;
2017 for (unsigned long i = 1; i < (unsigned long)size; ++i) counter[i] = counter[i - 1] + 9 * nFacesComm[i - 1];
2018
2019 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nFacesLocComm; ++i) {
