2020 unsigned long rankFace = localFacesComm[i].elemID1;
2021 unsigned long ii = counter[rankFace];
2022 counter[rankFace] += 9;
2023
2024 sendBufFace[ii] = localFacesComm[i].nCornerPoints;
2025 sendBufFace[ii + 1] = localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[0];
2026 sendBufFace[ii + 2] = localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[1];
2027 sendBufFace[ii + 3] = localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[2];
2028 sendBufFace[ii + 4] = localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[3];
2029 sendBufFace[ii + 5] = localFacesComm[i].elemID0;
2030 sendBufFace[ii + 6] = localFacesComm[i].nPolySol0;
2031 sendBufFace[ii + 7] = localFacesComm[i].nDOFsElem0;
2032 sendBufFace[ii + 8] = localFacesComm[i].elemType0;
2033 }
2034
2035 /*--- Determine the number of ranks from which I receive a message. */
2036 unsigned long nMessSend = 0;
2037 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < (unsigned long)size; ++i) {
2038 if (nFacesComm[i]) {
2039 counter[i] = 1;
2040 ++nMessSend;
2041 } else
2042 counter[i] = 0;
2043 }
2044 vector<int> sizeRecv(size, 1);
2045
2046 unsigned long nMessRecv;
2047 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(counter.data(), &nMessRecv, sizeRecv.data(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2048
2049 /*--- Send the data using nonblocking sends. ---*/
2050 vector<SU2_MPI::Request> commReqs(max(nMessSend, nMessRecv));
2051
2052 nMessSend = 0;
2053 unsigned long indSend = 0;
2054 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < (unsigned long)size; ++i) {
2055 if (nFacesComm[i]) {
2056 unsigned long count = 9 * nFacesComm[i];
2057 SU2_MPI::Isend(&sendBufFace[indSend], count, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[nMessSend]);
2058 ++nMessSend;
2059 indSend += count;
2060 }
2061 }
2062
2063 /*--- Loop over the number of ranks from which faces are received.
2064 Receive the messages and store them in facesRecv. ---*/
2065 vector<CFaceOfElement> facesRecv;
2066 vector<unsigned long> nFacesRecv(nMessRecv + 1);
2067 vector<int> rankRecv(nMessRecv);
2068 nFacesRecv[0] = 0;
2069 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nMessRecv; ++i) {
2070 SU2_MPI::Status status;
2071 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
2072 rankRecv[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
2073 int sizeMess;
2074 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
2075
2076 vector<unsigned long> recvBuf(sizeMess);
2077 SU2_MPI::Recv(recvBuf.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, rankRecv[i], rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
2078
2079 nFacesRecv[i + 1] = nFacesRecv[i] + sizeMess / 9;
2080 facesRecv.resize(nFacesRecv[i + 1]);
2081 unsigned long ii = 0;
2082 for (unsigned long j = nFacesRecv[i]; j < nFacesRecv[i + 1]; ++j, ii += 9) {
2083 facesRecv[j].nCornerPoints = recvBuf[ii];
2084 facesRecv[j].cornerPoints[0] = recvBuf[ii + 1];
2085 facesRecv[j].cornerPoints[1] = recvBuf[ii + 2];
2086 facesRecv[j].cornerPoints[2] = recvBuf[ii + 3];
2087 facesRecv[j].cornerPoints[3] = recvBuf[ii + 4];
2088 facesRecv[j].elemID0 = recvBuf[ii + 5];
2089 facesRecv[j].nPolySol0 = recvBuf[ii + 6];
2090 facesRecv[j].nDOFsElem0 = recvBuf[ii + 7];
2091 facesRecv[j].elemType0 = recvBuf[ii + 8];
2092 }
2093 }
2094
2095 /*--- The exact contents of facesRecv is needed when communicating back
2096 the data to the original ranks, so a copy is made of facesRecv.
2097 As localFacesComm is not needed anymore, this vector is used
2098 for the sorting and searching of the data of facesRecv. ---*/
2099 localFacesComm = facesRecv;
2100 sort(localFacesComm.begin(), localFacesComm.end());
2101
2102 nFacesLocComm = localFacesComm.size();
2103 for (unsigned long i = 1; i < localFacesComm.size(); ++i) {
2104 if (localFacesComm[i] == localFacesComm[i - 1]) {
2105 localFacesComm[i - 1].elemID1 = localFacesComm[i].elemID0;
2106 localFacesComm[i - 1].nPolySol1 = localFacesComm[i].nPolySol0;
2107 localFacesComm[i - 1].nDOFsElem1 = localFacesComm[i].nDOFsElem0;
2108 localFacesComm[i - 1].elemType1 = localFacesComm[i].elemType0;
2109
2110 localFacesComm[i].nCornerPoints = 4;
2111 localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[0] = Global_nPoint;
2112 localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[1] = Global_nPoint;
2113 localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[2] = Global_nPoint;
2114 localFacesComm[i].cornerPoints[3] = Global_nPoint;
2115 --nFacesLocComm;
2116 }
2117 }
2118
2119 sort(localFacesComm.begin(), localFacesComm.end());
2120 localFacesComm.resize(nFacesLocComm);
2121
2122 /*--- Complete the first round of non-blocking sends. ---*/
2123 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nMessSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
2124
2125 /*--- Send the data back to the requesting ranks. ---*/
2126 sendBufFace.resize(9 * nFacesRecv[nMessRecv]);
2127 indSend = 0;
2128 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nMessRecv; ++i) {
2129 unsigned long ii = indSend;
2130 for (unsigned long j = nFacesRecv[i]; j < nFacesRecv[i + 1]; ++j, ii += 9) {
2131 sendBufFace[ii] = facesRecv[j].nCornerPoints;
2132 sendBufFace[ii + 1] = facesRecv[j].cornerPoints[0];
2133 sendBufFace[ii + 2] = facesRecv[j].cornerPoints[1];
2134 sendBufFace[ii + 3] = facesRecv[j].cornerPoints[2];
2135 sendBufFace[ii + 4] = facesRecv[j].cornerPoints[3];
2136
2137 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
2138 low = lower_bound(localFacesComm.begin(), localFacesComm.end(), facesRecv[j]);
2139 if (facesRecv[j].elemID0 == low->elemID0) {
2140 sendBufFace[ii + 5] = low->elemID1;
2141 sendBufFace[ii + 6] = low->nPolySol1;
2142 sendBufFace[ii + 7] = low->nDOFsElem1;
2143 sendBufFace[ii + 8] = low->elemType1;
2144 } else {
2145 sendBufFace[ii + 5] = low->elemID0;
2146 sendBufFace[ii + 6] = low->nPolySol0;
2147 sendBufFace[ii + 7] = low->nDOFsElem0;
2148 sendBufFace[ii + 8] = low->elemType0;
2149 }
2150 }
2151
2152 unsigned long count = ii - indSend;
2153 SU2_MPI::Isend(&sendBufFace[indSend], count, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, rankRecv[i], rankRecv[i] + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
2154 &commReqs[i]);
2155 indSend = ii;
2156 }
2157
2158 /*--- Loop over the ranks to which I originally sent my face data.
2159 The return data contains information about the neighboring element. ---*/
2160 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nMessSend; ++i) {
2161 SU2_MPI::Status status;
2162 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
2163 int sizeMess;
2164 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
2165
2166 vector<unsigned long> recvBuf(sizeMess);
2167 SU2_MPI::Recv(recvBuf.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, status.MPI_SOURCE, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
2168 &status);
2169
2170 sizeMess /= 9;
2171 unsigned long jj = 0;
2172 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < (unsigned long)sizeMess; ++j, jj += 9) {
2173 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2174 thisFace.nCornerPoints = recvBuf[jj];
2175 thisFace.cornerPoints[0] = recvBuf[jj + 1];
2176 thisFace.cornerPoints[1] = recvBuf[jj + 2];
2177 thisFace.cornerPoints[2] = recvBuf[jj + 3];
2178 thisFace.cornerPoints[3] = recvBuf[jj + 4];
2179
2180 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
2181 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
2182 low->elemID1 = recvBuf[jj + 5];
2183 low->nPolySol1 = recvBuf[jj + 6];
2184 low->nDOFsElem1 = recvBuf[jj + 7];
2185 low->elemType1 = recvBuf[jj + 8];
2186 }
2187 }
2188
2189 /*--- Complete the second round of non-blocking sends. ---*/
2190 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nMessRecv, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
2191
2192 /*--- Wild cards have been used in the communication, so
2193 synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. ---*/
2194 SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2195
2196#endif
2197
2198 /*--- In the procedure above the periodic boundaries are not found.
2199 A different treatment must be used in order to find these. ---*/
2200 DeterminePeriodicFacesFEMGrid(config, localFaces);
2201
2202 /*--- Determine the total number of non-matching faces in the grid. ---*/
2203 nFacesLoc = localFaces.size();
2204 nFacesLocOr = nFacesLoc;
2205 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nFacesLocOr; ++i) {
2206 if (localFaces[i].elemID1 > Global_nElem) {
2207 localFaces[i].nCornerPoints = 4;
2208 localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = Global_nPoint;
2209 localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = Global_nPoint;
2210 localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = Global_nPoint;
2211 localFaces[i].cornerPoints[3] = Global_nPoint;
2212 --nFacesLoc;
2213 }
2214 }
2215
2216 nFacesLocOr -= nFacesLoc;
2217 if (nFacesLocOr) {
2218 sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
2219 localFaces.resize(nFacesLoc);
2220 }
2221
2222 unsigned long nNonMatchingFaces = nFacesLocOr;
2223
2224#ifdef HAVE_MPI
2225 SU2_MPI::Reduce(&nFacesLocOr, &nNonMatchingFaces, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2226#endif
2227 if (rank == MASTER_NODE && nNonMatchingFaces) {
2228 cout << "There are " << nNonMatchingFaces << " non-matching faces in the grid. "
2229 << "These are ignored in the partitioning." << endl;
2230 }
2231
2232 /*--- Determine whether or not the Jacobians of the elements and faces
2233 can be considered constant. ---*/
2234 DetermineFEMConstantJacobiansAndLenScale(config);
2235
2236 /*--- Determine the donor elements for the wall function treatment. ---*/
2237 DetermineDonorElementsWallFunctions(config);
2238
2239 /*--- Determine the time levels of the elements. This is only relevant
2240 when time accurate local time stepping is employed. ---*/
2241 map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T> mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel;
2242 DetermineTimeLevelElements(config, localFaces, mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel);
2243
2244 /*--- Determine the ownership of the internal faces, i.e. which adjacent
2245 element is responsible for computing the fluxes through the face. ---*/
2246 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nFacesLoc; ++i) {
2247 /* Check for a matching face. */
2248 if (localFaces[i].elemID1 < Global_nElem) {
2249 /* Determine the time level for both elements. Elem0 is always owned, while
2250 elem1 is either owned or external. The data for external elements is
2251 stored in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel. */
2252 unsigned long elemID0 = localFaces[i].elemID0 - beg_node[rank];
2253 unsigned short timeLevel0 = elem[elemID0]->GetTimeLevel();
2254
2255 unsigned short timeLevel1;
2256 if (localFaces[i].elemID1 >= beg_node[rank] && localFaces[i].elemID1 < beg_node[rank] + nElem) {
2257 unsigned long elemID1 = localFaces[i].elemID1 - beg_node[rank];
2258 timeLevel1 = elem[elemID1]->GetTimeLevel();
2259 } else {
2260 map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T>::const_iterator MI;
2261 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(localFaces[i].elemID1);
2262 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end())
2263 SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2264 timeLevel1 = MI->second.short0;
2265 }
2266
2267 /* Check if both elements have the same time level. */
2268 if (timeLevel0 == timeLevel1) {
2269 /* Same time level, hence both elements can own the face. First check whether
2270 elemID0 == elemID1 (which happens for periodic problems with only one
2271 element in the periodic direction), because this is a special case. */
2272 if (localFaces[i].elemID0 == localFaces[i].elemID1) {
2273 /* This face occurs twice, but should be owned only once. Base this
2274 decision on the periodic index. */
2275 localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = localFaces[i].periodicIndex < localFaces[i].periodicIndexDonor;
2276 } else {
2277 /* Different elements on both sides of the face. The ownership decision
2278 below makes an attempt to spread the workload evenly. */
2279 const unsigned long sumElemID = localFaces[i].elemID0 + localFaces[i].elemID1;
2280 if (sumElemID % 2)
2281 localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = localFaces[i].elemID0 < localFaces[i].elemID1;
2282 else
2283 localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = localFaces[i].elemID0 > localFaces[i].elemID1;
2284 }
2285 } else {
2286 /* The time level of both elements differ. The element with the smallest
2287 time level must be the owner of the element. */
2288 localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = timeLevel0 < timeLevel1;
2289 }
2290 } else {
2291 /* Non-matching face. Give the ownership to element 0. */
2292 localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = true;
2293 }
2294 }
2295
2296 /*--- All the matching face information is known now, including periodic
2297 faces. Store the information of the neighbors in the data structure
2298 for the local elements. ---*/
2299 for (unsigned long k = 0; k < nElem; ++k) {
2300 unsigned short nFaces;
2301 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
2302 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
2303
2304 elem[k]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2305 elem[k]->InitializeNeighbors(nFaces);
2306
2307 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nFaces; ++i) {
2308 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2309 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[i];
2310 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[i][j];
2311 thisFace.elemID0 = beg_node[rank] + k;
2312 thisFace.nPolySol0 = elem[k]->GetNPolySol();
2313 thisFace.nDOFsElem0 = elem[k]->GetNDOFsSol();
2314
2315 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
2316
2317 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
2318 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
2319
2320 if (low != localFaces.end()) {
2321 if (!(thisFace < *low)) {
2322 if (low->elemID0 == thisFace.elemID0) {
2323 elem[k]->SetNeighbor_Elements(low->elemID1, i);
2324 elem[k]->SetOwnerFace(low->elem0IsOwner, i);
2325 } else {
2326 elem[k]->SetNeighbor_Elements(low->elemID0, i);
2327 elem[k]->SetOwnerFace(!(low->elem0IsOwner), i);
2328 }
2329
2330 if (low->periodicIndex > 0) elem[k]->SetPeriodicIndex(low->periodicIndex - 1, i);
2331 }
2332 }
2333 }
2334 }
2335
2336 /*--- Create the vector of vectors that describe the connectivity
2337 of the graph. First the faces. ---*/
2338 vector<vector<unsigned long> > adjacency(nElem, vector<unsigned long>(0));
2339 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nFacesLoc; ++i) {
2340 long ii = localFaces[i].elemID0 - beg_node[rank];
2341 adjacency[ii].push_back(localFaces[i].elemID1);
2342
2343 if (localFaces[i].periodicIndex == 0) {
2344 ii = localFaces[i].elemID1 - beg_node[rank];
2345 if (ii >= 0 && ii < (long)nElem) adjacency[ii].push_back(localFaces[i].elemID0);
2346 }
2347 }
2348
2349 /* It is possible that some neighbors appear multiple times due to e.g.
2350 periodic boundary conditions. ParMETIS is not able to deal with this
2351 situation, hence these multiple entries must be removed. */
2352 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
2353 sort(adjacency[i].begin(), adjacency[i].end());
2354 vector<unsigned long>::iterator lastEntry;
2355 lastEntry = unique(adjacency[i].begin(), adjacency[i].end());
2356 adjacency[i].erase(lastEntry, adjacency[i].end());
2357 }
2358
2359 /* Due to periodic boundary conditions it is also possible that self entries
2360 are present. ParMETIS is not able to deal with self entries, hence
2361 they must be removed as well. */
2362 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
2363 const unsigned long globalElemID = i + beg_node[rank];
2364 unsigned long nEntriesNew = adjacency[i].size();
2365
2366 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < adjacency[i].size(); ++j) {
2367 if (adjacency[i][j] == globalElemID) {
2368 adjacency[i][j] = ULONG_MAX;
2369 --nEntriesNew;
2370 }
2371 }
2372
2373 sort(adjacency[i].begin(), adjacency[i].end());
2374 adjacency[i].resize(nEntriesNew);
2375 }
2376
2377 /*--- Possibly add the connectivities in the graph from the wall function
2378 treatment. As these connectivities are one-sided, they must be stored
2379 and communicated later. ---*/
2380 vector<unsigned long> additionalExternalEntriesGraph;
2381
2382 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
2383 for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++l) {
2384 /* Get the global and local element ID adjacent to this boundary face. */
2385 const unsigned long globalElemID = bound[iMarker][l]->GetDomainElement();
2386 const unsigned long elemID = globalElemID - beg_node[rank];
2387
2388 /* Get the number of donor elements for the wall function treatment
2389 and the pointer to the array which stores this info. */
2390 const unsigned short nDonors = bound[iMarker][l]->GetNDonorsWallFunctions();
2391 const unsigned long* donors = bound[iMarker][l]->GetDonorsWallFunctions();
2392
2393 /* Loop over the number of donors and add the entry in the graph,
2394 if not already present. */
2395 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDonors; ++i) {
2396 if (donors[i] != globalElemID) {
2397 if (!binary_search(adjacency[elemID].begin(), adjacency[elemID].end(), donors[i])) {
2398 /* Donor not present in the graph for elemID. Add it and sort it
2399 afterwards, such that a binary search can be applied later. */
2400 adjacency[elemID].push_back(donors[i]);
2401 sort(adjacency[elemID].begin(), adjacency[elemID].end());
2402
2403 /* Check if the donor element is stored locally. */
2404 if (donors[i] >= beg_node[rank] && donors[i] < beg_node[rank] + nElem) {
2405 /* Donor is stored locally. Add the entry to the graph
2406 and sort it afterwards. */
2407 const unsigned long localDonorID = donors[i] - beg_node[rank];
2408 adjacency[localDonorID].push_back(globalElemID);
2409 sort(adjacency[localDonorID].begin(), adjacency[localDonorID].end());
2410 } else {
2411 /* Donor is stored externally. Store the graph entry in
2412 additionalExternalEntriesGraph. */
2413 additionalExternalEntriesGraph.push_back(donors[i]);
2414 additionalExternalEntriesGraph.push_back(globalElemID);
2415 }
2416 }
2417 }
2418 }
2419 }
2420 }
2421
2422#ifdef HAVE_MPI
2423 /*--- Create the send buffers with the additional graph data and determine
2424 to which ranks data is sent. ---*/
2425 vector<vector<unsigned long> > sendBufsGraphData(size, vector<unsigned long>(0));
2426 vector<int> sendToRank(size, 0);
2427
2428 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < additionalExternalEntriesGraph.size(); i += 2) {
2429 /* Determine the rank where this external is stored. */
2430 const unsigned long elemID = additionalExternalEntriesGraph[i];
2431 int rankElem;
2432 if (elemID >= beg_node[size - 1])
2433 rankElem = size - 1;
2434 else {
2435 const unsigned long* low;
2436 low = lower_bound(beg_node, beg_node + size, elemID);
2437
2438 rankElem = low - beg_node;
2439 if (*low > elemID) --rankElem;
2440 }
2441
2442 sendBufsGraphData[rankElem].push_back(additionalExternalEntriesGraph[i]);
2443 sendBufsGraphData[rankElem].push_back(additionalExternalEntriesGraph[i + 1]);
2444 sendToRank[rankElem] = 1;
2445 }
2446
2447 /*-- Determine to how many ranks this rank will send data and from how
2448 many ranks it will receive data. ---*/
2449 int nRankSend = 0;
2450 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
2451 if (sendToRank[i]) ++nRankSend;
2452 }
2453
2454 int nRankRecv;
2455 vector<int> sizeSend(size, 1);
2456 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeSend.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2457
2458 /* Send the data using non-blocking sends. */
2459 vector<SU2_MPI::Request> sendReqs(nRankSend);
2460 nRankSend = 0;
2461 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
2462 if (sendToRank[i])
2463 SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBufsGraphData[i].data(), sendBufsGraphData[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i,
2464 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &sendReqs[nRankSend++]);
2465 }
2466
2467 /* Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank receives data. */
2468 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
2469 /* Block until a message with unsigned longs arrives from any processor.
2470 Determine the source and the size of the message. */
2471 SU2_MPI::Status status;
2472 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
2473 int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
2474
2475 int sizeMess;
2476 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
2477
2478 /* Allocate the memory for the receive buffer and receive the message
2479 using a blocking receive. */
2480 vector<unsigned long> recvBuf(sizeMess);
2481 SU2_MPI::Recv(recvBuf.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
2482
2483 /* Loop over the contents of the receive buffer and update the
2484 graph accordingly. */
2485 for (int j = 0; j < sizeMess; j += 2) {
2486 const unsigned long elemID = recvBuf[j] - beg_node[rank];
2487 adjacency[elemID].push_back(recvBuf[j + 1]);
2488 sort(adjacency[elemID].begin(), adjacency[elemID].end());
2489 }
2490 }
2491
2492 /* Complete the non-blocking sends amd synchronize the ranks, because
2493 wild cards have been used in the above communication. */
2494 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
2495 SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2496
2497#endif
2498
2499 /* Allocate the memory to store the weights of the graph. */
2500 vector<su2double> vwgt(2 * nElem);
2501 vector<vector<su2double> > adjwgt(nElem, vector<su2double>(0));
2502
2503 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) adjwgt[i].resize(adjacency[i].size());
2504
2505 /* Compute the weigts of the graph. */
2506 ComputeFEMGraphWeights(config, localFaces, adjacency, mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel, vwgt, adjwgt);
2507
2508 /*--- The remainder of this function should only be called if we have parallel
2509 support with MPI and have the ParMETIS library compiled and linked. ---*/
2510
2511#ifdef HAVE_MPI
2512#ifdef HAVE_PARMETIS
2513
2514 /*--- Only call ParMETIS if we have more than one rank to avoid errors ---*/
2515 if (size > SINGLE_NODE) {
2516 /*--- The scalar variables and the options array for the call to ParMETIS. ---*/
2517 idx_t wgtflag = 3; // Weights on both the vertices and edges.
2518 idx_t numflag = 0; // C-numbering.
2519 idx_t ncon = 2; // Number of constraints.
2520 real_t ubvec[] = {1.05, 1.05}; // Tolerances for the vertex weights, recommended value is 1.05.
2521 auto nparts = (idx_t)size; // Number of subdomains. Must be number of MPI ranks.
2522 idx_t options[METIS_NOPTIONS]; // Just use the default options.
2523 METIS_SetDefaultOptions(options);
2524 options[1] = 0;
2525
2526 /*--- Determine the array, which stores the distribution of the graph nodes
2527 over the ranks. ---*/
2528 vector<idx_t> vtxdist(size + 1);
2529 vtxdist[0] = 0;
2530 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) vtxdist[i + 1] = (idx_t)end_node[i];
2531
2532 /* Create the array xadjPar, which contains the number of edges for each
2533 vertex of the graph in ParMETIS format. */
2534 vector<idx_t> xadjPar(nElem + 1);
2535 xadjPar[0] = 0;
2536 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) xadjPar[i + 1] = xadjPar[i] + (idx_t)adjacency[i].size();
2537
2538 /* Create the adjacency information in ParMETIS format. */
2539 vector<idx_t> adjacencyPar(xadjPar[nElem]);
2540 unsigned long ii = 0;
2541 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
2542 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < adjacency[i].size(); ++j, ++ii) adjacencyPar[ii] = adjacency[i][j];
2543 }
2544
2545 /* Create the vertex weights in ParMETIS format. */
2546 vector<idx_t> vwgtPar(nElem * ncon);
2547 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem * ncon; ++i) vwgtPar[i] = (idx_t)ceil(vwgt[i]);
2548
2549 /* Create the adjacency weight in ParMETIS format. */
2550 vector<idx_t> adjwgtPar(xadjPar[nElem]);
2551 ii = 0;
2552 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
2553 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < adjwgt[i].size(); ++j, ++ii) adjwgtPar[ii] = (idx_t)ceil(adjwgt[i][j]);
2554 }
2555
2556 /* Make sure that an equal distribution is obtained. */
2557 vector<real_t> tpwgts(size * ncon, 1.0 / ((real_t)size));
2558
2559 /*--- Calling ParMETIS ---*/
2560 vector<idx_t> part(nElem);
2561 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) cout << "Calling ParMETIS...";
2562
2563 idx_t edgecut;
2564 MPI_Comm comm = SU2_MPI::GetComm();
2565 ParMETIS_V3_PartKway(vtxdist.data(), xadjPar.data(), adjacencyPar.data(), vwgtPar.data(), adjwgtPar.data(),
2566 &wgtflag, &numflag, &ncon, &nparts, tpwgts.data(), ubvec, options, &edgecut, part.data(),
2567 &comm);
2568 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
2569 cout << " graph partitioning complete (";
2570 cout << edgecut << " edge cuts)." << endl;
2571 }
2572
2573 /*--- Set the color of the elements to the outcome of ParMETIS. ---*/
2574 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) elem[i]->SetColor(part[i]);
2575 }
2576
2577#else /* HAVE_PARMETIS */
2578
2579 if (size > SINGLE_NODE) {
2580 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
2581 cout << endl;
2582 cout << "--------------------- WARNING -------------------------------" << endl;
2583 cout << "SU2 compiled without PARMETIS. A linear distribution is used." << endl;
2584 cout << "This is very inefficient" << endl;
2585 cout << "-------------------------------------------------------------" << endl;
2586 cout << endl;
2587 }
2588
2589 /* Set the color to the current rank. */
2590 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) elem[i]->SetColor(rank);
2591 }
2592
2593#endif /* HAVE_PARMETIS */
2594
2595#endif /* HAVE_MPI */
2596}
2597
2598void CPhysicalGeometry::DeterminePeriodicFacesFEMGrid(CConfig* config, vector<CFaceOfElement>& localFaces) {
2599 /*--- Determine a mapping from the global point ID to the local index
2600 of the points. ---*/
2601 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> globalPointIDToLocalInd;
2602 for (unsigned i = 0; i < nPoint; ++i) {
2603 globalPointIDToLocalInd[nodes->GetGlobalIndex(i)] = i;
2604 }
2605
2606 /*--- Loop over the number of markers present in the grid and check for a periodic one. ---*/
2607 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); ++iMarker) {
2608 if (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY) {
2609 /*--- Determine the donor marker and the transformation from the
2610 current marker to the donor marker. ---*/
2611 unsigned short jMarker = config->GetMarker_Periodic_Donor(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker));
2612
2613 auto center = config->GetPeriodicRotCenter(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker));
2614 auto angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker));
2615 auto trans = config->GetPeriodicTranslation(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker));
2616
2617 /*--- Store (center+trans) as it is constant and will be added on. ---*/
2618 su2double translation[] = {center[0] + trans[0], center[1] + trans[1], center[2] + trans[2]};
2619
2620 /*--- Store angles separately for clarity. Compute sines/cosines. ---*/
2621 su2double theta = angles[0];
2622 su2double phi = angles[1];
2623 su2double psi = angles[2];
2624
2625 su2double cosTheta = cos(theta), cosPhi = cos(phi), cosPsi = cos(psi);
2626 su2double sinTheta = sin(theta), sinPhi = sin(phi), sinPsi = sin(psi);
2627
2628 /*--- Compute the rotation matrix. Note that the implicit
2629 ordering is rotation about the x-axis, y-axis, then z-axis. ---*/
2630 su2double rotMatrix[3][3];
2631 rotMatrix[0][0] = cosPhi * cosPsi;
2632 rotMatrix[1][0] = cosPhi * sinPsi;
2633 rotMatrix[2][0] = -sinPhi;
2634
2635 rotMatrix[0][1] = sinTheta * sinPhi * cosPsi - cosTheta * sinPsi;
2636 rotMatrix[1][1] = sinTheta * sinPhi * sinPsi + cosTheta * cosPsi;
2637 rotMatrix[2][1] = sinTheta * cosPhi;
2638
2639 rotMatrix[0][2] = cosTheta * sinPhi * cosPsi + sinTheta * sinPsi;
2640 rotMatrix[1][2] = cosTheta * sinPhi * sinPsi - sinTheta * cosPsi;
2641 rotMatrix[2][2] = cosTheta * cosPhi;
2642
2643 /*--- Define the vector to store the faces of the donor. Initialize its
2644 size to the number of local donor faces. ---*/
2645 vector<CMatchingFace> facesDonor(nElem_Bound[jMarker]);
2646
2647 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2648 /*--- Step 1: Store the information of the local faces of the donor
2649 marker in the variables defined above. ---*/
2650 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2651
2652 /*--- Loop over the local elements of the donor marker. ---*/
2653 for (unsigned long k = 0; k < nElem_Bound[jMarker]; ++k) {
2654 /*--- Get the connectivity of this face. The reason for the used
2655 function arguments for GetCornerPointsAllFaces, is that
2656 GetCornerPointsAllFaces is an overloaded function. ---*/
2657 unsigned short nFaces;
2658 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
2659 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
2660 bound[jMarker][k]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2661
2662 /*--- Search for this face in localFaces. It must be present. ---*/
2663 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2664 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[0];
2665 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[0]; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[0][j];
2666 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
2667
2668 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
2669 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
2670
2671 /*--- Store the relevant data in facesDonor. ---*/
2672 facesDonor[k].nDim = nDim;
2673 facesDonor[k].nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[0];
2674 facesDonor[k].elemID = low->elemID0;
2675 facesDonor[k].nPoly = low->nPolySol0;
2676 facesDonor[k].nDOFsElem = low->nDOFsElem0;
2677 facesDonor[k].elemType = low->elemType0;
2678
2679 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[0]; ++j) {
2680 map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator MI;
2681 MI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(faceConn[0][j]);
2682 unsigned long ind = MI->second;
2683
2684 for (unsigned l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) facesDonor[k].cornerCoor[j][l] = nodes->GetCoord(ind, l);
2685 }
2686
2687 /*--- Create the tolerance for this face and sort the coordinates. ---*/
2688 facesDonor[k].SortFaceCoordinates();
2689 }
2690
2691 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2692 /*--- Step 2: In parallel mode the data of the donor marker is
2693 gathered on all ranks. ---*/
2694 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2695
2696#ifdef HAVE_MPI
2697
2698 /*--- Check if this is indeed a parallel simulation. ---*/
2699 if (size > 1) {
2700 /*--- Allocate the memory for the size arrays in Allgatherv. ---*/
2701 vector<int> recvCounts(size), displs(size);
2702
2703 /*--- Create the values of recvCounts for the gather of the facesDonor. ---*/
2704 int sizeLocal = facesDonor.size();
2705
2706 SU2_MPI::Allgather(&sizeLocal, 1, MPI_INT, recvCounts.data(), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2707
2708 /*--- Create the data for the vector displs from the known values of
2709 recvCounts. Also determine the total size of the data. ---*/
2710 displs[0] = 0;
2711 for (int i = 1; i < size; ++i) displs[i] = displs[i - 1] + recvCounts[i - 1];
2712
2713 int sizeGlobal = displs.back() + recvCounts.back();
2714
2715 /*--- SU2_MPI does not support the communication of derived data types,
2716 at least not at the moment when this was coded. Therefore the data
2717 from facesDonor is copied into buffers of primitive types, which
2718 are communicated. ---*/
2719 vector<unsigned short> shortLocBuf(5 * sizeLocal);
2720 vector<unsigned long> longLocBuf(sizeLocal);
2721 vector<su2double> doubleLocBuf(13 * sizeLocal);
2722
2723 unsigned long cS = 0, cL = 0, cD = 0;
2724 for (vector<CMatchingFace>::const_iterator fIt = facesDonor.begin(); fIt != facesDonor.end(); ++fIt) {
2725 shortLocBuf[cS++] = fIt->nCornerPoints;
2726 shortLocBuf[cS++] = fIt->nDim;
2727 shortLocBuf[cS++] = fIt->nPoly;
2728 shortLocBuf[cS++] = fIt->nDOFsElem;
2729 shortLocBuf[cS++] = fIt->elemType;
2730
2731 longLocBuf[cL++] = fIt->elemID;
2732
2733 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[0][0];
2734 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[0][1];
2735 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[0][2];
2736
2737 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[1][0];
2738 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[1][1];
2739 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[1][2];
2740
2741 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[2][0];
2742 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[2][1];
2743 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[2][2];
2744
2745 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[3][0];
2746 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[3][1];
2747 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->cornerCoor[3][2];
2748
2749 doubleLocBuf[cD++] = fIt->tolForMatching;
2750 }
2751
2752 /*--- Gather the faces from all ranks to all ranks. Use Allgatherv
2753 for this purpose. ---*/
2754 vector<unsigned short> shortGlobBuf(5 * sizeGlobal);
2755 vector<unsigned long> longGlobBuf(sizeGlobal);
2756 vector<su2double> doubleGlobBuf(13 * sizeGlobal);
2757
2758 SU2_MPI::Allgatherv(longLocBuf.data(), longLocBuf.size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, longGlobBuf.data(),
2759 recvCounts.data(), displs.data(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2760
2761 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
2762 recvCounts[i] *= 5;
2763 displs[i] *= 5;
2764 }
2765
2766 SU2_MPI::Allgatherv(shortLocBuf.data(), shortLocBuf.size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, shortGlobBuf.data(),
2767 recvCounts.data(), displs.data(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2768
2769 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
2770 recvCounts[i] /= 5;
2771 displs[i] /= 5;
2772 recvCounts[i] *= 13;
2773 displs[i] *= 13;
2774 }
2775
2776 SU2_MPI::Allgatherv(doubleLocBuf.data(), doubleLocBuf.size(), MPI_DOUBLE, doubleGlobBuf.data(),
2777 recvCounts.data(), displs.data(), MPI_DOUBLE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2778
2779 /*--- Copy the data back into facesDonor, which will contain the
2780 global information after the copies. ---*/
2781 facesDonor.resize(sizeGlobal);
2782 cS = cL = cD = 0;
2783
2784 for (auto fIt = facesDonor.begin(); fIt != facesDonor.end(); ++fIt) {
2785 fIt->nCornerPoints = shortGlobBuf[cS++];
2786 fIt->nDim = shortGlobBuf[cS++];
2787 fIt->nPoly = shortGlobBuf[cS++];
2788 fIt->nDOFsElem = shortGlobBuf[cS++];
2789 fIt->elemType = shortGlobBuf[cS++];
2790
2791 fIt->elemID = longGlobBuf[cL++];
2792
2793 fIt->cornerCoor[0][0] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2794 fIt->cornerCoor[0][1] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2795 fIt->cornerCoor[0][2] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2796
2797 fIt->cornerCoor[1][0] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2798 fIt->cornerCoor[1][1] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2799 fIt->cornerCoor[1][2] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2800
2801 fIt->cornerCoor[2][0] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2802 fIt->cornerCoor[2][1] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2803 fIt->cornerCoor[2][2] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2804
2805 fIt->cornerCoor[3][0] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2806 fIt->cornerCoor[3][1] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2807 fIt->cornerCoor[3][2] = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2808
2809 fIt->tolForMatching = doubleGlobBuf[cD++];
2810 }
2811 }
2812#endif
2813
2814 /*--- Sort facesDonor in increasing order. ---*/
2815 sort(facesDonor.begin(), facesDonor.end());
2816
2817 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2818 /*--- Step 3: Find for the current marker the required data in the
2819 variables for the donor marker. ---*/
2820 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2821
2822 /*--- Loop over the local faces of this boundary marker. ---*/
2823 for (unsigned long k = 0; k < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++k) {
2824 /*--- Get the connectivity of this face. The reason for the used
2825 function arguments for GetCornerPointsAllFaces, is that
2826 GetCornerPointsAllFaces is an overloaded function. ---*/
2827 unsigned short nFaces;
2828 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
2829 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
2830 bound[iMarker][k]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2831
2832 /*--- Search for this face in localFaces. It must be present. ---*/
2833 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2834 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[0];
2835 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[0]; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[0][j];
2836 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
2837
2838 vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
2839 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
2840
2841 /*--- Indicate that this face is a periodic face. This is accomplished
2842 by setting periodicIndex to iMarker + 1. ---*/
2843 low->periodicIndex = iMarker + 1;
2844
2845 /*--- Store the data for this boundary element also in thisMatchingFace,
2846 such that a search can be carried out in donorFaces. Note that the
2847 periodic transformation must be applied to the coordinates. ---*/
2848 CMatchingFace thisMatchingFace;
2849 thisMatchingFace.nDim = nDim;
2850 thisMatchingFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[0];
2851 thisMatchingFace.elemID = low->elemID0;
2852 thisMatchingFace.nPoly = low->nPolySol0;
2853 thisMatchingFace.nDOFsElem = low->nDOFsElem0;
2854 thisMatchingFace.elemType = low->elemType0;
2855
2856 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[0]; ++j) {
2857 map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator MI;
2858 MI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(faceConn[0][j]);
2859 unsigned long ind = MI->second;
2860 const su2double* coor = nodes->GetCoord(ind);
2861
2862 const su2double dx = coor[0] - center[0];
2863 const su2double dy = coor[1] - center[1];
2864 const su2double dz = nDim == 3 ? coor[2] - center[2] : su2double(0.0);
2865
2866 thisMatchingFace.cornerCoor[j][0] =
2867 rotMatrix[0][0] * dx + rotMatrix[0][1] * dy + rotMatrix[0][2] * dz + translation[0];
2868 thisMatchingFace.cornerCoor[j][1] =
2869 rotMatrix[1][0] * dx + rotMatrix[1][1] * dy + rotMatrix[1][2] * dz + translation[1];
2870 thisMatchingFace.cornerCoor[j][2] =
2871 rotMatrix[2][0] * dx + rotMatrix[2][1] * dy + rotMatrix[2][2] * dz + translation[2];
2872 }
2873
2874 /*--- Create the tolerance for this face and sort the coordinates. ---*/
2875 thisMatchingFace.SortFaceCoordinates();
2876
2877 /*--- Check if thisMatchingFace is present in facesDonor. If so, set the
2878 missing information in the face corresponding to the iterator low. ---*/
2879 vector<CMatchingFace>::const_iterator donorLow;
2880 donorLow = lower_bound(facesDonor.begin(), facesDonor.end(), thisMatchingFace);
2881
2882 if (donorLow != facesDonor.end()) {
2883 if (!(thisMatchingFace < *donorLow)) {
2884 low->elemID1 = donorLow->elemID;
2885 low->nPolySol1 = donorLow->nPoly;
2886 low->nDOFsElem1 = donorLow->nDOFsElem;
2887 low->elemType1 = donorLow->elemType;
2888 low->periodicIndexDonor = jMarker + 1;
2889 }
2890 }
2891 }
2892 }
2893 }
2894}
2895
2896void CPhysicalGeometry::DetermineFEMConstantJacobiansAndLenScale(CConfig* config) {
2897 /* Definition of the object that is used to carry out the BLAS calls. */
2898 CBlasStructure blasFunctions;
2899
2900 /*--- Determine a mapping from the global point ID to the local index
2901 of the points. ---*/
2902 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> globalPointIDToLocalInd;
2903 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nPoint; ++i) {
2904 globalPointIDToLocalInd[nodes->GetGlobalIndex(i)] = i;
2905 }
2906
2907 /*--- Define the vectors to store the standard elements for the volume elements
2908 and surface faces. These standard elements will be created based on the
2909 polynomial degree of the grid. ---*/
2910 vector<CFEMStandardElement> standardVolumeElements, standardFaceElements;
2911
2912 /*--- Loop over the local volume elements. ---*/
2913 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
2914 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2915 /*--- Compute the Jacobians of the volume element and determine ---*/
2916 /*--- whether the Jacobians can be considered constant. ---*/
2917 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2918
2919 /*--- Determine the standard element of the volume element. If it does not
2920 exist yet, it will be created. Note that it suffices to indicate that
2921 the Jacobians are constant, because the only task here is to determine
2922 whether or not the Jacobians are constant. ---*/
2923 unsigned short VTK_Type = elem[i]->GetVTK_Type();
2924 unsigned short nPolyGrid = elem[i]->GetNPolyGrid();
2925
2926 unsigned long ii;
2927 for (ii = 0; ii < standardVolumeElements.size(); ++ii) {
2928 if (standardVolumeElements[ii].SameStandardElement(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, true)) break;
2929 }
2930
2931 if (ii == standardVolumeElements.size()) standardVolumeElements.emplace_back(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, true, config);
2932
2933 /*--- Allocate the memory for some help vectors to carry out the matrix
2934 product to determine the derivatives of the coordinates w.r.t.
2935 the parametric coordinates. ---*/
2936 unsigned short nDOFs = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetNDOFs();
2937 unsigned short nIntegration = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetNIntegration();
2938
2939 unsigned long sizeResult = nDim * nDim * nIntegration;
2940 unsigned long sizeRHS = nDim * nDOFs;
2941
2942 vector<su2double> vecResult(sizeResult), vecRHS(sizeRHS);
2943
2944 /* Store the coordinates in vecRHS. */
2945 unsigned long jj = 0;
2946 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFs; ++j) {
2947 unsigned long nodeID = elem[i]->GetNode(j);
2948
2949 map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator MI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeID);
2950 unsigned long ind = MI->second;
2951 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDim; ++k, ++jj) vecRHS[jj] = nodes->GetCoord(ind, k);
2952 }
2953
2954 /*--- Get the pointer to the matrix storage of the basis functions and its
2955 derivatives. The first nDOFs*nIntegration entries of this matrix
2956 correspond to the interpolation data to the integration points
2957 and are not needed. Hence this part is skipped. ---*/
2958 const su2double* matBasisInt = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
2959 const su2double* matDerBasisInt = &matBasisInt[nDOFs * nIntegration];
2960
2961 /* Carry out the matrix matrix product. The last argument is NULL, such
2962 that this gemm call is ignored in the profiling. Replace by config if
2963 if should be included. */
2964 blasFunctions.gemm(nDim * nIntegration, nDim, nDOFs, matDerBasisInt, vecRHS.data(), vecResult.data(), nullptr);
2965
2966 /*--- Compute the Jacobians in the integration points and determine
2967 the minimum and maximum values. Make a distinction between
2968 a 2D and 3D element. ---*/
2969 su2double jacMin = 1.e+25, jacMax = -1.e+25;
2970
2971 switch (nDim) {
2972 case 2: {
2973 /* 2D computation. Store the offset between the r and s derivatives. */
2974 const unsigned int off = 2 * nIntegration;
2975
2976 /*--- Loop over the integration points to compute the Jacobians. ---*/
2977 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nIntegration; ++j) {
2978 const unsigned int jx = 2 * j;
2979 const unsigned int jy = jx + 1;
2980 const su2double dxdr = vecResult[jx], dydr = vecResult[jy];
2981 const su2double dxds = vecResult[jx + off], dyds = vecResult[jy + off];
2982
2983 const su2double Jac = dxdr * dyds - dxds * dydr;
2984
2985 jacMin = min(jacMin, Jac);
2986 jacMax = max(jacMax, Jac);
2987 }
2988
2989 break;
2990 }
2991
2992 case 3: {
2993 /* 3D computation. Store the offset between the r and s and r and t derivatives. */
2994 const unsigned int offS = 3 * nIntegration, offT = 6 * nIntegration;
2995
2996 /*--- Loop over the integration points to compute the Jacobians. ---*/
2997 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nIntegration; ++j) {
2998 const unsigned int jx = 3 * j;
2999 const unsigned int jy = jx + 1, jz = jx + 2;
3000 const su2double dxdr = vecResult[jx], dydr = vecResult[jy], dzdr = vecResult[jz];
3001 const su2double dxds = vecResult[jx + offS], dyds = vecResult[jy + offS], dzds = vecResult[jz + offS];
3002 const su2double dxdt = vecResult[jx + offT], dydt = vecResult[jy + offT], dzdt = vecResult[jz + offT];
3003
3004 const su2double Jac = dxdr * (dyds * dzdt - dzds * dydt) - dxds * (dydr * dzdt - dzdr * dydt) +
3005 dxdt * (dydr * dzds - dzdr * dyds);
3006
3007 jacMin = min(jacMin, Jac);
3008 jacMax = max(jacMax, Jac);
3009 }
3010
3011 break;
3012 }
3013 }
3014
3015 /*--- Check for negative Jacobians. ---*/
3016 if (jacMin <= 0.0) SU2_MPI::Error("Negative Jacobian found", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3017
3018 /*--- Determine the ratio of the maximum and minimum value of the Jacobian.
3019 From this ratio, determine whether or not the element is considered to
3020 have a constant Jacobian. ---*/
3021 bool constJacobian = (jacMax / jacMin) <= 1.000001;
3022 elem[i]->SetJacobianConsideredConstant(constJacobian);
3023
3024 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3025 /*--- Compute the normal vectors of the faces of the element and check ---*/
3026 /*--- for constant Jacobians of the faces. ---*/
3027 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3028
3029 /*--- Get the global IDs of the corner points of all the faces
3030 of this element. ---*/
3031 unsigned short nFaces;
3032 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
3033 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
3034
3035 elem[i]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
3036
3037 /*--- Reset the array, which stores whether or not the faces are
3038 considered to have a constant Jacobian, to false. ---*/
3039 elem[i]->ResetJacobianConstantFaces();
3040
3041 /*--- Loop over the number of faces of this element. ---*/
3042 su2double jacFaceMax = 0.0;
3043 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nFaces; ++j) {
3044 /*--- Determine the index jj in the standard face elements for this face.
3045 If not present, create the standard element. ---*/
3046 switch (nPointsPerFace[j]) {
3047 case 2:
3048 VTK_Type = LINE;
3049 break;
3050 case 3:
3051 VTK_Type = TRIANGLE;
3052 break;
3053 case 4:
3054 VTK_Type = QUADRILATERAL;
3055 break;
3056 }
3057
3058 for (jj = 0; jj < standardFaceElements.size(); ++jj) {
3059 if (standardFaceElements[jj].SameStandardElement(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, true)) break;
3060 }
3061
3062 if (jj == standardFaceElements.size()) standardFaceElements.emplace_back(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, true, config);
3063
3064 /*--- Set the pointer to store the face connectivity of this face. ---*/
3065 unsigned short* connFace = nullptr;
3066 switch (j) {
3067 case 0:
3068 connFace = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetConnFace0();
3069 break;
3070 case 1:
3071 connFace = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetConnFace1();
3072 break;
3073 case 2:
3074 connFace = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetConnFace2();
3075 break;
3076 case 3:
3077 connFace = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetConnFace3();
3078 break;
3079 case 4:
3080 connFace = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetConnFace4();
3081 break;
3082 case 5:
3083 connFace = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetConnFace5();
3084 break;
3085 }
3086
3087 /*--- Store the relevant derivative vectors of the standard element of
3088 the face as well as the number of DOFs and integration points. ---*/
3089 nDOFs = standardFaceElements[jj].GetNDOFs();
3090 nIntegration = standardFaceElements[jj].GetNIntegration();
3091
3092 const su2double* dr = standardFaceElements[jj].GetDrBasisFunctionsIntegration();
3093 const su2double* ds = standardFaceElements[jj].GetDsBasisFunctionsIntegration();
3094
3095 /*--- Allocate the memory for the vector to store the normals in the
3096 integration points of the face. */
3097 vector<su2double> normalsFace((nDim + 1) * nIntegration);
3098
3099 /*--- Compute the unit normals in the integration points. Make a
3100 distinction between two and three dimensions. ---*/
3101 switch (nDim) {
3102 case 2: {
3103 /*--- Two dimensional case, for which the faces are edges.
3104 The normal is the vector normal to the tangent vector
3105 of the edge. Loop over the integration points. ---*/
3106 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nIntegration; ++k) {
3107 const su2double* drr = &dr[k * nDOFs];
3108 su2double dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0;
3109 for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDOFs; ++l) {
3110 dxdr += vecRHS[2 * connFace[l]] * drr[l];
3111 dydr += vecRHS[2 * connFace[l] + 1] * drr[l];
3112 }
3113
3114 normalsFace[3 * k] = dydr;
3115 normalsFace[3 * k + 1] = -dxdr;
3116 normalsFace[3 * k + 2] = sqrt(dxdr * dxdr + dydr * dydr);
3117 }
3118
3119 break;
3120 }
3121
3122 case 3: {
3123 /*--- Three dimensional case, for which the faces are triangles or
3124 quadrilaterals. The normal is the vector obtained via the
3125 cross product of two tangent vectors.
3126 Loop over the integration points. ---*/
3127 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nIntegration; ++k) {
3128 const su2double *drr = &dr[k * nDOFs], *dss = &ds[k * nDOFs];
3129 su2double dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0, dzdr = 0.0, dxds = 0.0, dyds = 0.0, dzds = 0.0;
3130
3131 for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDOFs; ++l) {
3132 dxdr += vecRHS[3 * connFace[l]] * drr[l];
3133 dxds += vecRHS[3 * connFace[l]] * dss[l];
3134 dydr += vecRHS[3 * connFace[l] + 1] * drr[l];
3135 dyds += vecRHS[3 * connFace[l] + 1] * dss[l];
3136 dzdr += vecRHS[3 * connFace[l] + 2] * drr[l];
3137 dzds += vecRHS[3 * connFace[l] + 2] * dss[l];
3138 }
3139
3140 su2double nx = dydr * dzds - dyds * dzdr;
3141 su2double ny = dxds * dzdr - dxdr * dzds;
3142 su2double nz = dxdr * dyds - dxds * dydr;
3143
3144 normalsFace[4 * k] = nx;
3145 normalsFace[4 * k + 1] = ny;
3146 normalsFace[4 * k + 2] = nz;
3147 normalsFace[4 * k + 3] = sqrt(nx * nx + ny * ny + nz * nz);
3148 }
3149
3150 break;
3151 }
3152 }
3153
3154 /*--- Double loop over the integration points to determine the minimum
3155 value of the cosine between the normals. Also the minimum and
3156 maximum length of the normal is determined. ---*/
3157 su2double normLenMin = 1.0e-15, normLenMax = 0.0;
3158 su2double minCosAngleFaceNormals = 1.0;
3159 unsigned short kk = (nDim + 1);
3160 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nIntegration; ++k) {
3161 if (k == 0)
3162 normLenMin = normLenMax = normalsFace[nDim];
3163 else {
3164 normLenMin = min(normLenMin, normalsFace[k * kk + nDim]);
3165 normLenMax = max(normLenMax, normalsFace[k * kk + nDim]);
3166 }
3167
3168 for (unsigned short l = k + 1; l < nIntegration; ++l) {
3169 su2double dot = 0.0;
3170 for (unsigned short m = 0; m < nDim; ++m) dot += normalsFace[k * kk + m] * normalsFace[l * kk + m];
3171 dot /= normalsFace[k * kk + nDim] * normalsFace[l * kk + nDim];
3172
3173 minCosAngleFaceNormals = min(minCosAngleFaceNormals, dot);
3174 }
3175 }
3176
3177 /*--- Compute the ratio of normLenMin and normLenMax and determine
3178 whether the face is considered to have a constant Jacobian. ---*/
3179 su2double maxRatioLenFaceNormals = normLenMax / normLenMin;
3180
3181 constJacobian = minCosAngleFaceNormals >= 0.999999 && maxRatioLenFaceNormals <= 1.000001;
3182
3183 elem[i]->SetJacobianConstantFace(constJacobian, j);
3184
3185 /* Update the maximum value of the Jacobian of all faces surrounding
3186 the current element. */
3187 jacFaceMax = max(jacFaceMax, normLenMax);
3188 }
3189
3190 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3191 /*--- Determine the length scale of the element. This is needed to ---*/
3192 /*--- compute the computational weights of an element when time ---*/
3193 /*--- accurate local time stepping is employed and to determine a ---*/
3194 /*--- tolerance when periodic transformations are present. Note that a ---*/
3195 /*--- factor 2 must be taken into account, which is the length scale ---*/
3196 /*--- of all the reference elements used in this code. ---*/
3197 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3198
3199 const su2double lenScale = 2.0 * jacMin / jacFaceMax;
3200 elem[i]->SetLengthScale(lenScale);
3201 }
3202}
3203
3204void CPhysicalGeometry::DetermineDonorElementsWallFunctions(CConfig* config) {
3205 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3206 /*--- Step 1: Check whether wall functions are used at all. ---*/
3207 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3208
3209 bool wallFunctions = false;
3210 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3211 switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
3212 case ISOTHERMAL:
3213 case HEAT_FLUX: {
3214 const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
3215 if (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != WALL_FUNCTIONS::NONE) wallFunctions = true;
3216 break;
3217 }
3218 default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
3219 break;
3220 }
3221 }
3222
3223 /* If no wall functions are used, nothing needs to be done and a
3224 return can be made. */
3225 if (!wallFunctions) return;
3226
3227 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3228 /*--- Step 2: Build the ADT of the linear sub-elements of the locally ---*/
3229 /*--- stored volume elements. ---*/
3230 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3231
3232 /* Determine a mapping from the global point ID to the local index
3233 of the points. */
3234 map<unsigned long, unsigned long> globalPointIDToLocalInd;
3235 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nPoint; ++i) {
3236 globalPointIDToLocalInd[nodes->GetGlobalIndex(i)] = i;
3237 }
3238
3239 /* Define the vector to store the standard element for the volume elements. */
3240 vector<CFEMStandardElement> standardVolumeElements;
3241
3242 /* Define the vectors, which store the mapping from the subelement to the
3243 parent element, subelement ID within the parent element, the element
3244 type and the connectivity of the subelements. */
3245 vector<unsigned long> parentElement;
3246 vector<unsigned short> subElementIDInParent;
3247 vector<unsigned short> VTK_TypeElem;
3248 vector<unsigned long> elemConn;
3249
3250 /* Loop over the local volume elements to create the connectivity of
3251 the linear sub-elements. */
3252 for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nElem; ++l) {
3253 /* Determine the standard element of the volume element. If it does not
3254 exist yet, it will be created. Note that it suffices to create a
3255 standard element for a constant Jacobian, because the element is
3256 split into its linear sub-elements for the ADT. */
3257 unsigned short VTK_Parent = elem[l]->GetVTK_Type();
3258 unsigned short nPolyGrid = elem[l]->GetNPolyGrid();
3259
3260 unsigned long ii;
3261 for (ii = 0; ii < standardVolumeElements.size(); ++ii) {
3262 if (standardVolumeElements[ii].SameStandardElement(VTK_Parent, nPolyGrid, true)) break;
3263 }
3264
3265 if (ii == standardVolumeElements.size()) standardVolumeElements.emplace_back(VTK_Parent, nPolyGrid, true, config);
3266
3267 /* Determine the necessary data for splitting the element in its linear
3268 sub-elements. */
3269 unsigned short VTK_Type[] = {standardVolumeElements[ii].GetVTK_Type1(), standardVolumeElements[ii].GetVTK_Type2()};
3270 unsigned short nSubElems[] = {0, 0};
3271 unsigned short nDOFsPerSubElem[] = {0, 0};
3272 const unsigned short* connSubElems[] = {nullptr, nullptr};
3273
3274 if (VTK_Type[0] != NONE) {
3275 nSubElems[0] = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetNSubElemsType1();
3276 nDOFsPerSubElem[0] = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetNDOFsPerSubElem(VTK_Type[0]);
3277 connSubElems[0] = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetSubConnType1();
3278 }
3279
3280 if (VTK_Type[1] != NONE) {
3281 nSubElems[1] = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetNSubElemsType2();
3282 nDOFsPerSubElem[1] = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetNDOFsPerSubElem(VTK_Type[1]);
3283 connSubElems[1] = standardVolumeElements[ii].GetSubConnType2();
3284 }
3285
3286 /* Store the connectivity of the sub-elements. Note that local node
3287 numbering must be used for these sub-elements. */
3288 unsigned short jj = 0;
3289 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
3290 unsigned short kk = 0;
3291 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nSubElems[i]; ++j, ++jj) {
3292 parentElement.push_back(elem[l]->GetGlobalElemID());
3293 subElementIDInParent.push_back(jj);
3294 VTK_TypeElem.push_back(VTK_Type[i]);
3295
3296 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFsPerSubElem[i]; ++k, ++kk) {
3297 unsigned long nodeID = elem[l]->GetNode(connSubElems[i][kk]);
3298 map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator MI;
3299 MI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeID);
3300
3301 elemConn.push_back(MI->second);
3302 }
3303 }
3304 }
3305 }
3306
3307 /* Store the coordinates of the locally stored nodes in the format
3308 expected by the ADT. */
3309 vector<su2double> volCoor(nDim * nPoint);
3310
3311 unsigned long jj = 0;
3312 for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nPoint; ++l) {
3313 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDim; ++k, ++jj) volCoor[jj] = nodes->GetCoord(l, k);
3314 }
3315
3316 /* Build the local ADT. */
3317 CADTElemClass localVolumeADT(nDim, volCoor, elemConn, VTK_TypeElem, subElementIDInParent, parentElement, false);
3318
3319 /* Release the memory of the vectors used to build the ADT. To make sure
3320 that all the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. */
3321 vector<unsigned short>().swap(subElementIDInParent);
3322 vector<unsigned short>().swap(VTK_TypeElem);
3323 vector<unsigned long>().swap(parentElement);
3324 vector<unsigned long>().swap(elemConn);
3325 vector<su2double>().swap(volCoor);
3326
3327 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3328 /*--- Step 3. Search for donor elements at the exchange locations in ---*/
3329 /*--- the local elements. ---*/
3330 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3331
3332 /* Define the vectors, which store the boundary marker, boundary element ID
3333 and exchange coordinates for the integration points for which no donor
3334 element was found in the locally stored volume elements. */
3335 vector<unsigned short> markerIDGlobalSearch;
3336 vector<unsigned long> boundaryElemIDGlobalSearch;
3337 vector<su2double> coorExGlobalSearch;
3338
3339 /* Define the standard boundary faces for the solution and the grid. */
3340 vector<CFEMStandardBoundaryFace> standardBoundaryFacesSol, standardBoundaryFacesGrid;
3341
3342 /* Loop over the markers and select the ones for which a wall function
3343 treatment must be carried out. */
3344 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3345 switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
3346 case ISOTHERMAL:
3347 case HEAT_FLUX: {
3348 const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
3349 if (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != WALL_FUNCTIONS::NONE) {
3350 /* Retrieve the floating point information for this boundary marker.
3351 The exchange location is the first element of this array. */
3352 const su2double* doubleInfo = config->GetWallFunction_DoubleInfo(Marker_Tag);
3353
3354 /* Loop over the local boundary elements for this marker. */
3355 for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++l) {
3356 /* Easier storage of the element type, the corresponding volume
3357 element and the polynomial degree for the solution and grid. */
3358 const unsigned short VTK_Type = bound[iMarker][l]->GetVTK_Type();
3359 const unsigned long elemID = bound[iMarker][l]->GetDomainElement() - beg_node[rank];
3360 const unsigned short nPolyGrid = bound[iMarker][l]->GetNPolyGrid();
3361 const unsigned short nPolySol = elem[elemID]->GetNPolySol();
3362 const unsigned short VTK_Elem = elem[elemID]->GetVTK_Type();
3363
3364 /* Get the corner points of the boundary element. Note that this
3365 is an overloaded function, hence the arguments that allow for
3366 multiple faces. */
3367 unsigned short nFaces;
3368 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
3369 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
3370 bound[iMarker][l]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
3371
3372 /* Create an object of CFaceOfElement to store the information. */
3373 CFaceOfElement boundaryFace;
3374 boundaryFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[0];
3375 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nPointsPerFace[0]; ++i) boundaryFace.cornerPoints[i] = faceConn[0][i];
3376 boundaryFace.elemID0 = elemID;
3377
3378 /* Renumber the corner points of the face, but keep the orientation. */
3379 boundaryFace.CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation();
3380 const bool boundaryFaceSwapped = boundaryFace.elemID1 == elemID;
3381
3382 /* Get the corner points of all the faces from the corresponding
3383 volume element. */
3384 elem[elemID]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
3385
3386 /* Loop over the faces of the element to determine which one is
3387 the boundary face. */
3388 unsigned long ii;
3389 bool outwardPointing = true; /* Initialized to avoid compiler warning. */
3390 for (ii = 0; ii < nFaces; ++ii) {
3391 /* Create an object of CFaceOfElement to store the information.
3392 Renumber the corner points, but keep the orientation. */
3393 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
3394 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[ii];
3395 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nPointsPerFace[ii]; ++i) thisFace.cornerPoints[i] = faceConn[ii][i];
3396 thisFace.elemID0 = elemID;
3397
3398 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation();
3399 const bool thisFaceSwapped = thisFace.elemID1 == elemID;
3400
3401 /* Check if this face is the boundary face. */
3402 if (boundaryFace == thisFace) {
3403 /* Determine whether the orientation of the boundary face is
3404 pointing out of the adjacent element. */
3405 outwardPointing = boundaryFaceSwapped == thisFaceSwapped;
3406
3407 /* Break the loop over the faces of the element. */
3408 break;
3409 }
3410 }
3411
3412 /* Additional check, just to be sure. */
3413 if (ii == nFaces) SU2_MPI::Error("Boundary face not found in faces of element", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3414
3415 /* Determine whether or not the Jacobian of the boundary face
3416 is constant. */
3417 const bool constJac = elem[elemID]->GetJacobianConstantFace(ii);
3418 bound[iMarker][l]->SetJacobianConsideredConstant(constJac);
3419
3420 /* Determine the corresponding standard element. If it does not
3421 exist yet, it will be created. Note that the polynomial degree
3422 of both the solution and grid must match. If a new standard
3423 element must be created, make sure that the integration points
3424 of the solution element are used for the grid element. */
3425 for (ii = 0; ii < standardBoundaryFacesSol.size(); ++ii) {
3426 if (standardBoundaryFacesSol[ii].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type, constJac, VTK_Elem, nPolySol,
3427 false) &&
3428 standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ii].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type, constJac, VTK_Elem, nPolyGrid,
3429 false))
3430 break;
3431 }
3432
3433 if (ii == standardBoundaryFacesSol.size()) {
3434 standardBoundaryFacesSol.emplace_back(VTK_Type, VTK_Elem, nPolySol, constJac, false, config);
3435 standardBoundaryFacesGrid.emplace_back(VTK_Type, VTK_Elem, nPolyGrid, constJac, false, config,
3436 standardBoundaryFacesSol[ii].GetOrderExact());
3437 }
3438
3439 /* Get the required information from the standard element. */
3440 const unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ii].GetNDOFsFace();
3441 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ii].GetNIntegration();
3442 const su2double* lag = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ii].GetBasisFaceIntegration();
3443 const su2double* dr = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ii].GetDrBasisFaceIntegration();
3444 const su2double* ds = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ii].GetDsBasisFaceIntegration();
3445
3446 /* Create the vector of coordinates for this boundary face. */
3447 vector<su2double> coorBoundFace(nDim * nDOFs);
3448 ii = 0;
3449 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFs; ++j) {
3450 unsigned long nodeID = bound[iMarker][l]->GetNode(j);
3451 map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator MI;
3452 MI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeID);
3453 nodeID = MI->second;
3454 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDim; ++k, ++ii) coorBoundFace[ii] = nodes->GetCoord(nodeID, k);
3455 }
3456
3457 /* Set the multiplication factor for the normal, such that
3458 an inward pointing normal is obtained. It is scaled with
3459 the exchange distance. */
3460 const su2double factNorm = outwardPointing ? -doubleInfo[0] : doubleInfo[0];
3461
3462 /* Allocate the memory for the exchange locations corresponding to
3463 the integration points of this face. */
3464 vector<su2double> coorExchange(nDim * nInt);
3465
3466 /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D to compute the actual
3467 coordinates of the exchange locations. */
3468 switch (nDim) {
3469 case 2: {
3470 /* Two dimensional computation. Loop over the integration
3471 points to compute the corresponding exchange coordinates. */
3472 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
3473 /* Compute the coordinates and the tangential vector
3474 in the integration point. */
3475 su2double xInt = 0.0, yInt = 0.0, dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0;
3476 const su2double* lagInt = lag + i * nDOFs;
3477 const su2double* drr = dr + i * nDOFs;
3478
3479 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) {
3480 const su2double* coorDOF = coorBoundFace.data() + 2 * k;
3481 xInt += lagInt[k] * coorDOF[0];
3482 yInt += lagInt[k] * coorDOF[1];
3483 dxdr += drr[k] * coorDOF[0];
3484 dydr += drr[k] * coorDOF[1];
3485 }
3486
3487 /* Compute the vector from the integration point to
3488 the coordinates of the exchange location. This is the
3489 unit inward normal multiplied by the exchange distance. */
3490 const su2double lenNorm = sqrt(dxdr * dxdr + dydr * dydr);
3491 const su2double invLenNorm = lenNorm < su2double(1.e-35) ? su2double(1.e+35) : 1.0 / lenNorm;
3492
3493 const su2double dx = factNorm * dydr * invLenNorm;
3494 const su2double dy = -factNorm * dxdr * invLenNorm;
3495
3496 /* Compute the coordinates of the exchange location. */
3497 su2double* coorEx = coorExchange.data() + nDim * i;
3498 coorEx[0] = xInt + dx;
3499 coorEx[1] = yInt + dy;
3500 }
3501
3502 break;
3503 }
3504
3505 case 3: {
3506 /* Three dimensional computation. Loop over the integration
3507 points to compute the corresponding exchange coordinates. */
3508 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
3509 /* Compute the coordinates and the tangential vectors
3510 in the integration point. */
3511 const su2double* lagInt = lag + i * nDOFs;
3512 const su2double *drr = dr + i * nDOFs, *dss = ds + i * nDOFs;
3513 su2double xInt = 0.0, yInt = 0.0, zInt = 0.0, dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0, dzdr = 0.0, dxds = 0.0,
3514 dyds = 0.0, dzds = 0.0;
3515
3516 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) {
3517 const su2double* coorDOF = coorBoundFace.data() + 3 * k;
3518 xInt += lagInt[k] * coorDOF[0];
3519 yInt += lagInt[k] * coorDOF[1];
3520 zInt += lagInt[k] * coorDOF[2];
3521 dxdr += drr[k] * coorDOF[0];
3522 dydr += drr[k] * coorDOF[1];
3523 dzdr += drr[k] * coorDOF[2];
3524 dxds += dss[k] * coorDOF[0];
3525 dyds += dss[k] * coorDOF[1];
3526 dzds += dss[k] * coorDOF[2];
3527 }
3528
3529 /* Compute the outward pointing normal. */
3530 const su2double nx = -(dydr * dzds - dyds * dzdr);
3531 const su2double ny = -(dxds * dzdr - dxdr * dzds);
3532 const su2double nz = -(dxdr * dyds - dxds * dydr);
3533
3534 /* Compute the vector from the integration point to
3535 the coordinates of the exchange location. This is the
3536 unit inward normal multiplied by the exchange distance. */
3537 const su2double lenNorm = sqrt(nx * nx + ny * ny + nz * nz);
3538 const su2double invLenNorm = lenNorm < su2double(1.e-35) ? su2double(1.e+35) : 1.0 / lenNorm;
3539
3540 const su2double dx = factNorm * nx * invLenNorm;
3541 const su2double dy = factNorm * ny * invLenNorm;
3542 const su2double dz = factNorm * nz * invLenNorm;
3543
3544 /* Compute the coordinates of the exchange location. */
3545 su2double* coorEx = coorExchange.data() + nDim * i;
3546 coorEx[0] = xInt + dx;
3547 coorEx[1] = yInt + dy;
3548 coorEx[2] = zInt + dz;
3549 }
3550
3551 break;
3552 }
3553 }
3554
3555 /* Loop over the integration points and determine the donor elements
3556 for the corresponding exchange locations. */
3557 vector<unsigned long> donorElementsFace;
3558 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
3559 /* Search for the element, which contains the exchange location. */
3560 unsigned short subElem;
3561 unsigned long parElem;
3562 int mpirank;
3563 su2double parCoor[3], weightsInterpol[8];
3564 su2double* coorEx = coorExchange.data() + nDim * i;
3565
3566 if (localVolumeADT.DetermineContainingElement(coorEx, subElem, parElem, mpirank, parCoor,
3567 weightsInterpol)) {
3568 /* Donor element found. Store it in donorElementsFace. */
3569 donorElementsFace.push_back(parElem);
3570 } else {
3571 /* Donor element not found in the local ADT. Store the exchange
3572 coordinates, boundary marker and boundary element ID. */
3573 markerIDGlobalSearch.push_back(iMarker);
3574 boundaryElemIDGlobalSearch.push_back(l);
3575 for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) coorExGlobalSearch.push_back(coorEx[iDim]);
3576 }
3577 }
3578
3579 /* Sort donorElementsFace in increasing order and remove the
3580 the double entities. */
3581 sort(donorElementsFace.begin(), donorElementsFace.end());
3582 vector<unsigned long>::iterator lastEntry;
3583 lastEntry = unique(donorElementsFace.begin(), donorElementsFace.end());
3584 donorElementsFace.erase(lastEntry, donorElementsFace.end());
3585
3586 /* Store the donor elements in the data structure for
3587 this boundary element. */
3588 bound[iMarker][l]->SetDonorsWallFunctions(donorElementsFace);
3589 }
3590 }
3591
3592 break;
3593 }
3594 default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
3595 break;
3596 }
3597 }
3598
3599#ifndef HAVE_MPI
3600 /* In sequential mode it should not be possible that there are points for which
3601 no donor elements are found. Check this. */
3602 if (markerIDGlobalSearch.size()) {
3603 ostringstream message;
3604 message << markerIDGlobalSearch.size() << " integration points for which "
3605 << "no donor elements for the wall functions were found." << endl
3606 << "Something is seriously wrong";
3607 SU2_MPI::Error("message.str()", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3608 }
3609#endif
3610
3611 /* The remaining part of this function only needs to be carried out in parallel mode. */
3612#ifdef HAVE_MPI
3613
3614 /* Determine the number of search points for which a global search must be
3615 carried out for each rank and store them in such a way that the info can
3616 be used directly in Allgatherv. */
3617 vector<int> recvCounts(size), displs(size);
3618 int nLocalSearchPoints = (int)markerIDGlobalSearch.size();
3619
3620 SU2_MPI::Allgather(&nLocalSearchPoints, 1, MPI_INT, recvCounts.data(), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3621 displs[0] = 0;
3622 for (int i = 1; i < size; ++i) displs[i] = displs[i - 1] + recvCounts[i - 1];
3623
3624 int nGlobalSearchPoints = displs.back() + recvCounts.back();
3625
3626 /* Check if there actually are global searches to be carried out. */
3627 if (nGlobalSearchPoints > 0) {
3628 /* Create a cumulative storage version of recvCounts. */
3629 vector<int> nSearchPerRank(size + 1);
3630 nSearchPerRank[0] = 0;
3631
3632 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) nSearchPerRank[i + 1] = nSearchPerRank[i] + recvCounts[i];
3633
3634 /* Gather the data of the search points for which a global search must
3635 be carried out on all ranks. */
3636 vector<unsigned short> bufMarkerIDGlobalSearch(nGlobalSearchPoints);
3637 SU2_MPI::Allgatherv(markerIDGlobalSearch.data(), nLocalSearchPoints, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT,
3638 bufMarkerIDGlobalSearch.data(), recvCounts.data(), displs.data(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT,
3639 SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3640
3641 vector<unsigned long> bufBoundaryElemIDGlobalSearch(nGlobalSearchPoints);
3642 SU2_MPI::Allgatherv(boundaryElemIDGlobalSearch.data(), nLocalSearchPoints, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG,
3643 bufBoundaryElemIDGlobalSearch.data(), recvCounts.data(), displs.data(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG,
3644 SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3645
3646 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3647 recvCounts[i] *= nDim;
3648 displs[i] *= nDim;
3649 }
3650 vector<su2double> bufCoorExGlobalSearch(nDim * nGlobalSearchPoints);
3651 SU2_MPI::Allgatherv(coorExGlobalSearch.data(), nDim * nLocalSearchPoints, MPI_DOUBLE, bufCoorExGlobalSearch.data(),
3652 recvCounts.data(), displs.data(), MPI_DOUBLE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3653
3654 /* Buffers to store the return information. */
3655 vector<unsigned short> markerIDReturn;
3656 vector<unsigned long> boundaryElemIDReturn;
3657 vector<unsigned long> volElemIDDonorReturn;
3658
3659 /* Loop over the number of global search points to check if these points
3660 are contained in the volume elements of this rank. The loop is carried
3661 out as a double loop, such that the rank where the point resides is
3662 known as well. Furthermore, it is not necessary to search the points
3663 that were not found earlier on this rank. The vector recvCounts is used
3664 as storage for the number of search items that must be returned to the
3665 other ranks. */
3666 for (int rankID = 0; rankID < size; ++rankID) {
3667 recvCounts[rankID] = 0;
3668 if (rankID != rank) {
3669 for (int i = nSearchPerRank[rankID]; i < nSearchPerRank[rankID + 1]; ++i) {
3670 /* Search the local ADT for the coordinate of the exchange point
3671 and check if it is found. */
3672 unsigned short subElem;
3673 unsigned long parElem;
3674 int rankDonor;
3675 su2double parCoor[3], weightsInterpol[8];
3676 if (localVolumeADT.DetermineContainingElement(bufCoorExGlobalSearch.data() + i * nDim, subElem, parElem,
3677 rankDonor, parCoor, weightsInterpol)) {
3678 /* Store the required data in the return buffers. */
3679 ++recvCounts[rankID];
3680 markerIDReturn.push_back(bufMarkerIDGlobalSearch[i]);
3681 boundaryElemIDReturn.push_back(bufBoundaryElemIDGlobalSearch[i]);
3682 volElemIDDonorReturn.push_back(parElem);
3683 }
3684 }
3685 }
3686 }
3687
3688 /* Create a cumulative version of recvCounts. */
3689 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) nSearchPerRank[i + 1] = nSearchPerRank[i] + recvCounts[i];
3690
3691 /* Determine the number of return messages this rank has to receive.
3692 Use displs and recvCounts as temporary storage. */
3693 int nRankSend = 0;
3694 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3695 if (recvCounts[i]) {
3696 recvCounts[i] = 1;
3697 ++nRankSend;
3698 }
3699 displs[i] = 1;
3700 }
3701
3702 int nRankRecv;
3703 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(recvCounts.data(), &nRankRecv, displs.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3704
3705 /* Send the data using nonblocking sends to avoid deadlock. */
3706 vector<SU2_MPI::Request> commReqs(3 * nRankSend);
3707 nRankSend = 0;
3708 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3709 if (recvCounts[i]) {
3710 const int sizeMessage = nSearchPerRank[i + 1] - nSearchPerRank[i];
3711 SU2_MPI::Isend(markerIDReturn.data() + nSearchPerRank[i], sizeMessage, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, i, i,
3712 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[nRankSend++]);
3713 SU2_MPI::Isend(boundaryElemIDReturn.data() + nSearchPerRank[i], sizeMessage, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i + 1,
3714 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[nRankSend++]);
3715 SU2_MPI::Isend(volElemIDDonorReturn.data() + nSearchPerRank[i], sizeMessage, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i + 2,
3716 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[nRankSend++]);
3717 }
3718 }
3719
3720 /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive return data. */
3721 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
3722 /* Block until a message with unsigned shorts arrives from any processor.
3723 Determine the source and the size of the message. */
3724 SU2_MPI::Status status;
3725 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
3726 int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
3727
3728 int sizeMess;
3729 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, &sizeMess);
3730
3731 /* Allocate the memory for the receive buffers. */
3732 vector<unsigned short> bufMarkerIDReturn(sizeMess);
3733 vector<unsigned long> bufBoundaryElemIDReturn(sizeMess);
3734 vector<unsigned long> bufVolElemIDDonorReturn(sizeMess);
3735
3736 /* Receive the three messages using blocking receives. */
3737 SU2_MPI::Recv(bufMarkerIDReturn.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, source, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
3738
3739 SU2_MPI::Recv(bufBoundaryElemIDReturn.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
3740 &status);
3741
3742 SU2_MPI::Recv(bufVolElemIDDonorReturn.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, rank + 2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
3743 &status);
3744
3745 /* Loop over the data just received and add it to the wall function
3746 donor information of the corresponding boundary element. */
3747 for (int j = 0; j < sizeMess; ++j) {
3748 const unsigned short iMarker = bufMarkerIDReturn[j];
3749 const unsigned long l = bufBoundaryElemIDReturn[j];
3750 const unsigned long volID = bufVolElemIDDonorReturn[j];
3751
3752 bound[iMarker][l]->AddDonorWallFunctions(volID);
3753 }
3754 }
3755
3756 /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
3757 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3758
3759 /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
3760 so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
3761 SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3762
3763 /* Loop again over the boundary elements of the marker for which a wall
3764 function treatment must be used and make remove the multiple entries
3765 of the donor information. */
3766 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3767 switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
3768 case ISOTHERMAL:
3769 case HEAT_FLUX: {
3770 const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
3771 if (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != WALL_FUNCTIONS::NONE) {
3772 for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++l)
3773 bound[iMarker][l]->RemoveMultipleDonorsWallFunctions();
3774 }
3775
3776 break;
3777 }
3778
3779 default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
3780 break;
3781 }
3782 }
3783 }
3784
3785#endif
3786}
3787
3788void CPhysicalGeometry::DetermineTimeLevelElements(CConfig* config, const vector<CFaceOfElement>& localFaces,
3789 map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T>& mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel) {
3790 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3791 /*--- Step 1: Initialize the map mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel. ---*/
3792 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3793
3794 /*--- Initialize the time level of external elements to zero.
3795 First the externals from the faces. ---*/
3796 for (auto FI = localFaces.begin(); FI != localFaces.end(); ++FI) {
3797 if (FI->elemID1 < Global_nElem) { // Safeguard against non-matching faces.
3798
3799 if (FI->elemID1 < beg_node[rank] || FI->elemID1 >= beg_node[rank] + nElem) {
3800 /* This element is an external element. Store it in the map
3801 mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel if not already done so. */
3802 map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T>::iterator MI;
3803 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(FI->elemID1);
3804 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end())
3805 mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel[FI->elemID1] = CUnsignedShort2T(0, 0);
3806 }
3807 }
3808 }
3809
3810 /* Define the communication buffers to send additional externals
3811 to other ranks. Also define the buffer recvFromRank which is used
3812 in Reduce_scatter later on. It indicates whether or not a message
3813 is sent to a certain rank. */
3814 vector<vector<unsigned long> > sendBufAddExternals(size, vector<unsigned long>(0));
3815 vector<int> recvFromRank(size, 0);
3816
3817 /*--- Add the externals from the wall function donors. Loop over the
3818 boundary elements of all markers. ---*/
3819 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3820 for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++l) {
3821 /* Get the number of donor elements for the wall function treatment
3822 and the pointer to the array which stores this info. */
3823 const unsigned short nDonors = bound[iMarker][l]->GetNDonorsWallFunctions();
3824 const unsigned long* donors = bound[iMarker][l]->GetDonorsWallFunctions();
3825
3826 /* Loop over the number of donors and add the externals to
3827 mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel, if not already present. */
3828 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDonors; ++i) {
3829 if (donors[i] < beg_node[rank] || donors[i] >= beg_node[rank] + nElem) {
3830 map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T>::iterator MI;
3831 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(donors[i]);
3832 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end()) {
3833 /* Element not present in external. Add it. */
3834 mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel[donors[i]] = CUnsignedShort2T(0, 0);
3835 }
3836
3837 /* The reverse connection may not be present either. Store the global
3838 ID of this element in the send buffers for the additional
3839 externals. */
3840 int rankDonor;
3841 if (donors[i] >= beg_node[size - 1])
3842 rankDonor = size - 1;
3843 else {
3844 const unsigned long* low;
3845 low = lower_bound(beg_node, beg_node + size, donors[i]);
3846
3847 rankDonor = (int)(low - beg_node);
3848 if (*low > donors[i]) --rankDonor;
3849 }
3850
3851 sendBufAddExternals[rankDonor].push_back(bound[iMarker][l]->GetDomainElement());
3852 recvFromRank[rankDonor] = 1;
3853 }
3854 }
3855 }
3856 }
3857
3858#ifdef HAVE_MPI
3859
3860 /* Determine the number of messages this rank will receive with additional
3861 externals to be stored. */
3862 int nRankRecv;
3863 vector<int> sizeSend(size, 1);
3864 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(recvFromRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeSend.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3865
3866 /* Determine the number of messages this rank will send. */
3867 int nRankSend = 0;
3868 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) nRankSend += recvFromRank[i];
3869
