3870 /* Send the data using non-blocking sends to avoid deadlock. */
3871 vector<SU2_MPI::Request> sendReqs(nRankSend);
3872 nRankSend = 0;
3873 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3874 if (recvFromRank[i]) {
3875 sort(sendBufAddExternals[i].begin(), sendBufAddExternals[i].end());
3876 auto lastElem = unique(sendBufAddExternals[i].begin(), sendBufAddExternals[i].end());
3877 sendBufAddExternals[i].erase(lastElem, sendBufAddExternals[i].end());
3878
3879 SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBufAddExternals[i].data(), sendBufAddExternals[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, i, i,
3880 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &sendReqs[nRankSend++]);
3881 }
3882 }
3883
3884 /* Loop over the number of ranks from which this rank will receive data
3885 to be stored in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel. */
3886 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
3887 /* Block until a message arrives and determine the source and size
3888 of the message. Allocate the memory for a receive buffer. */
3889 SU2_MPI::Status status;
3890 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
3891 int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
3892
3893 int sizeMess;
3894 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
3895 vector<unsigned long> recvBuf(sizeMess);
3896
3897 SU2_MPI::Recv(recvBuf.data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
3898
3899 /* Loop over the entries of recvBuf and add them to
3900 mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel, if not present already. */
3901 for (int j = 0; j < sizeMess; ++j) {
3902 map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T>::iterator MI;
3903 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(recvBuf[j]);
3904 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end()) mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel[recvBuf[j]] = CUnsignedShort2T(0, 0);
3905 }
3906 }
3907
3908 /* Complete the non-blocking sends. Synchronize the processors afterwards,
3909 because wild cards have been used in the communication. */
3910 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3911 SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3912
3913#endif
3914
3915 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3916 /*--- Step 2: Initialize the time level of the owned elements. ---*/
3917 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3918
3919 /*--- Get the number of time levels used and check whether or not
3920 time accurate local time stepping is used. ---*/
3921 const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
3922
3923 if (nTimeLevels == 1) {
3924 /*--- No time accurate local time stepping. Set the time level of
3925 all elements to zero. ---*/
3926 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) elem[i]->SetTimeLevel(0);
3927 } else {
3928 /*--- Time accurate local time stepping is used. The estimate of the time
3929 step is based on free stream values at the moment, but this is easy
3930 to change, if needed. ---*/
3931 const su2double Gamma = config->GetGamma();
3932 const su2double Prandtl = config->GetPrandtl_Lam();
3933
3934 const su2double Density = config->GetDensity_FreeStreamND();
3935 const su2double* Vel = config->GetVelocity_FreeStreamND();
3936 const su2double Viscosity = config->GetViscosity_FreeStreamND();
3937
3938 su2double VelMag = 0.0;
3939 for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) VelMag += Vel[iDim] * Vel[iDim];
3940 VelMag = sqrt(VelMag);
3941
3942 const su2double SoundSpeed = VelMag / config->GetMach();
3943
3944 /* In the estimate of the time step the spectral radius of the inviscid terms is
3945 needed. As the current estimate is based on the free stream, the value of this
3946 spectral radius can be computed beforehand. Note that this is a rather
3947 conservative estimate. */
3948 su2double charVel2 = 0.0;
3949 for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) {
3950 const su2double rad = fabs(Vel[iDim]) + SoundSpeed;
3951 charVel2 += rad * rad;
3952 }
3953
3954 const su2double charVel = sqrt(charVel2);
3955
3956 /* Also the viscous contribution to the time step is constant. Compute it. */
3957 const su2double factHeatFlux = Gamma / Prandtl;
3958 const su2double lambdaOverMu = -TWO3;
3959 const su2double radVisc = max(max(1.0, 2.0 + lambdaOverMu), factHeatFlux) * Viscosity / Density;
3960
3961 /*--- Allocate the memory for time step estimate of the local elements and
3962 determine the values. Also keep track of the minimum value. ---*/
3963 su2double minDeltaT = 1.e25;
3964 vector<su2double> timeStepElements(nElem);
3965
3966 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
3967 unsigned short nPoly = elem[i]->GetNPolySol();
3968 if (nPoly == 0) nPoly = 1;
3969 const su2double lenScaleInv = nPoly / elem[i]->GetLengthScale();
3970 const su2double lenScale = 1.0 / lenScaleInv;
3971
3972 timeStepElements[i] = lenScale / (charVel + lenScaleInv * radVisc);
3973 minDeltaT = min(minDeltaT, timeStepElements[i]);
3974 }
3975
3976 /* Determine the minimum value of all elements in the grid.
3977 Only needed for a parallel implementation. */
3978#ifdef HAVE_MPI
3979 su2double locVal = minDeltaT;
3980 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&locVal, &minDeltaT, 1, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_MIN, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3981#endif
3982
3983 /* Initial estimate of the time level of the owned elements. */
3984 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
3985 unsigned short timeLevel;
3986 su2double deltaT = minDeltaT;
3987 for (timeLevel = 0; timeLevel < (nTimeLevels - 1); ++timeLevel) {
3988 deltaT *= 2;
3989 if (timeStepElements[i] < deltaT) break;
3990 }
3991
3992 elem[i]->SetTimeLevel(timeLevel);
3993 }
3994 }
3995
3996 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3997 /*--- Step 3: Set up the variables to carry out the MPI communication ---*/
3998 /*--- of the external element data. ---*/
3999 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4000
4001 map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T>::iterator MI;
4002#ifdef HAVE_MPI
4003
4004 /*--- Determine the ranks from which I receive element data during
4005 the actual exchange. ---*/
4006 recvFromRank.assign(size, 0);
4007
4008 for (MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.begin(); MI != mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end(); ++MI) {
4009 /* Determine the rank where this external is stored. */
4010 const unsigned long elemID = MI->first;
4011 int rankElem;
4012 if (elemID >= beg_node[size - 1])
4013 rankElem = size - 1;
4014 else {
4015 const unsigned long* low;
4016 low = lower_bound(beg_node, beg_node + size, elemID);
4017
4018 rankElem = low - beg_node;
4019 if (*low > elemID) --rankElem;
4020 }
4021
4022 /* Set the corresponding index of recvFromRank to 1. */
4023 recvFromRank[rankElem] = 1;
4024 }
4025
4026 map<int, int> mapRankToIndRecv;
4027 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
4028 if (recvFromRank[i]) {
4029 int ind = mapRankToIndRecv.size();
4030 mapRankToIndRecv[i] = ind;
4031 }
4032 }
4033
4034 /* Determine the number of ranks from which I will receive data and to
4035 which I will send data. */
4036 nRankRecv = mapRankToIndRecv.size();
4037 SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(recvFromRank.data(), &nRankSend, sizeSend.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
4038
4039 /*--- Create the vector of vectors of the global element ID's that
4040 will be received from other ranks. ---*/
4041 vector<vector<unsigned long> > recvElem(nRankRecv, vector<unsigned long>(0));
4042
4043 for (MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.begin(); MI != mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end(); ++MI) {
4044 const unsigned long elemID = MI->first;
4045 int rankElem;
4046 if (elemID >= beg_node[size - 1])
4047 rankElem = size - 1;
4048 else {
4049 const unsigned long* low;
4050 low = lower_bound(beg_node, beg_node + size, elemID);
4051
4052 rankElem = low - beg_node;
4053 if (*low > elemID) --rankElem;
4054 }
4055
4056 map<int, int>::const_iterator MRI = mapRankToIndRecv.find(rankElem);
4057 recvElem[MRI->second].push_back(elemID);
4058 }
4059
4060 /*--- Loop over the ranks from which I receive data during the actual
4061 exchange and send over the global element ID's. In order to avoid
4062 unnecessary communication, multiple entries are filtered out. ---*/
4063 sendReqs.resize(nRankRecv);
4064 map<int, int>::const_iterator MRI = mapRankToIndRecv.begin();
4065
4066 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i, ++MRI) {
4067 sort(recvElem[i].begin(), recvElem[i].end());
4068 auto lastElem = unique(recvElem[i].begin(), recvElem[i].end());
4069 recvElem[i].erase(lastElem, recvElem[i].end());
4070
4071 SU2_MPI::Isend(recvElem[i].data(), recvElem[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MRI->first, MRI->first,
4072 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &sendReqs[i]);
4073 }
4074
4075 /*--- Receive the messages in arbitrary sequence and store the requested
4076 element ID's, which are converted to local ID's. Furthermore, store
4077 the processors from which the requested element ID's came from. ---*/
4078 vector<vector<unsigned long> > sendElem(nRankSend, vector<unsigned long>(0));
4079 vector<int> sendRank(nRankSend);
4080
4081 for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
4082 SU2_MPI::Status status;
4083 SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
4084 sendRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
4085
4086 int sizeMess;
4087 SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
4088 sendElem[i].resize(sizeMess);
4089
4090 SU2_MPI::Recv(sendElem[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, sendRank[i], rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
4091
4092 for (int j = 0; j < sizeMess; ++j) sendElem[i][j] -= beg_node[rank];
4093 }
4094
4095 /* Complete the non-blocking sends. Synchronize the processors afterwards,
4096 because wild cards have been used in the communication. */
4097 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankRecv, sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
4098 SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
4099
4100#endif
4101
4102 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4103 /*--- Step 4: Communicate the data of the externals. This data is the ---*/
4104 /*--- time level and the number of DOFs of the element. ---*/
4105 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4106
4107#ifdef HAVE_MPI
4108
4109 /* Define the send buffers and resize the vector of send requests. */
4110 vector<vector<unsigned short> > sendBuf(nRankSend, vector<unsigned short>(0));
4111 sendReqs.resize(nRankSend);
4112
4113 /* Define the return buffers and the vector of return requests. */
4114 vector<vector<unsigned short> > returnBuf(nRankRecv, vector<unsigned short>(0));
4115 vector<SU2_MPI::Request> returnReqs(nRankRecv);
4116
4117 /*--- Copy the information of the time level and number of DOFs into the
4118 send buffers and send the data using non-blocking sends. ---*/
4119 for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
4120 sendBuf[i].resize(2 * sendElem[i].size());
4121 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < sendElem[i].size(); ++j) {
4122 sendBuf[i][2 * j] = elem[sendElem[i][j]]->GetTimeLevel();
4123 sendBuf[i][2 * j + 1] = elem[sendElem[i][j]]->GetNDOFsSol();
4124 }
4125
4126 SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBuf[i].data(), sendBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, sendRank[i], sendRank[i],
4127 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &sendReqs[i]);
4128 }
4129
4130 /*--- Receive the data for the externals. As this data is needed immediately,
4131 blocking communication is used. The time level and the number of DOFs
4132 of the externals is stored in the second entry of the
4133 mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel, which is set accordingly. ---*/
4134 MRI = mapRankToIndRecv.begin();
4135 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i, ++MRI) {
4136 returnBuf[i].resize(2 * recvElem[i].size());
4137 SU2_MPI::Status status;
4138 SU2_MPI::Recv(returnBuf[i].data(), returnBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MRI->first, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
4139 &status);
4140
4141 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < recvElem[i].size(); ++j) {
4142 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(recvElem[i][j]);
4143 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end())
4144 SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4145 MI->second.short0 = returnBuf[i][2 * j];
4146 MI->second.short1 = returnBuf[i][2 * j + 1];
4147 }
4148 }
4149
4150 /* Complete the nonblocking sends. */
4151 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
4152
4153#endif
4154
4155 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4156 /*--- Step 5: Only when time accurate local time stepping is employed. ---*/
4157 /*--- Iterative algorithm to make sure that neighboring elements ---*/
4158 /*--- differ at most one time level. This is no fundamental ---*/
4159 /*--- issue, but it makes the parallel implementation easier, ---*/
4160 /*--- while the penalty in efficiency should be small for most ---*/
4161 /*--- cases. Furthermore, also for practical reasons, make sure ---*/
4162 /*--- that the donor elements for the wall function treatment ---*/
4163 /*--- have the same time level as the element to which the ---*/
4164 /*--- boundary face belongs. ---*/
4165 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4166
4167 /* Test for time accurate local time stepping. */
4168 if (nTimeLevels > 1) {
4169 /* Infinite loop for the iterative algorithm. */
4170 for (;;) {
4171 /* Variable to indicate whether the local situation has changed. */
4172 unsigned short localSituationChanged = 0;
4173
4174 /*--- Loop over the boundary markers and make sure that the time level
4175 of the element adjacent to the boundary and the donor element for
4176 the wall function treatment is the same. This is not much of a
4177 restriction, because in the vast majority of cases, the donor
4178 element is this adjacent element itself. Requiring it to be the
4179 same makes the implementation of the wall functions easier. ---*/
4180 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
4181 for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++l) {
4182 /* Determine the ID of the adjacent element. */
4183 const unsigned long elemID = bound[iMarker][l]->GetDomainElement() - beg_node[rank];
4184
4185 /* Get the number of donor elements for the wall function treatment
4186 and the pointer to the array which stores this info. */
4187 const unsigned short nDonors = bound[iMarker][l]->GetNDonorsWallFunctions();
4188 const unsigned long* donors = bound[iMarker][l]->GetDonorsWallFunctions();
4189
4190 /* Loop over the number of donors and check the time levels. */
4191 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDonors; ++i) {
4192 /* Determine the status of the donor element. */
4193 if (donors[i] >= beg_node[rank] && donors[i] < beg_node[rank] + nElem) {
4194 /* Donor is stored locally. Determine its local ID and
4195 get the time levels of both elements. */
4196 const unsigned long donorID = donors[i] - beg_node[rank];
4197 const unsigned short timeLevelB = elem[elemID]->GetTimeLevel();
4198 const unsigned short timeLevelD = elem[donorID]->GetTimeLevel();
4199 const unsigned short timeLevel = min(timeLevelB, timeLevelD);
4200
4201 /* If the time level of either element is larger than timeLevel,
4202 adapt the time levels and indicate that the local situation
4203 has changed. */
4204 if (timeLevelB > timeLevel) {
4205 elem[elemID]->SetTimeLevel(timeLevel);
4206 localSituationChanged = 1;
4207 }
4208
4209 if (timeLevelD > timeLevel) {
4210 elem[donorID]->SetTimeLevel(timeLevel);
4211 localSituationChanged = 1;
4212 }
4213 } else {
4214 /* The donor element is stored on a different processor.
4215 Retrieve its time level from mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel
4216 and determine the minimum time level. */
4217 const unsigned short timeLevelB = elem[elemID]->GetTimeLevel();
4218 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(donors[i]);
4219 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end())
4220 SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4221 const unsigned short timeLevel = min(timeLevelB, MI->second.short0);
4222
4223 /* If the time level of either element is larger than timeLevel,
4224 adapt the time levels and indicate that the local situation
4225 has changed. */
4226 if (timeLevelB > timeLevel) {
4227 elem[elemID]->SetTimeLevel(timeLevel);
4228 localSituationChanged = 1;
4229 }
4230
4231 if (MI->second.short0 > timeLevel) {
4232 MI->second.short0 = timeLevel;
4233 localSituationChanged = 1;
4234 }
4235 }
4236 }
4237 }
4238 }
4239
4240 /*--- Loop over the matching faces and update the time levels of the
4241 adjacent elements, if needed. ---*/
4242 for (auto FI = localFaces.begin(); FI != localFaces.end(); ++FI) {
4243 /* Safeguard against non-matching faces. */
4244 if (FI->elemID1 < Global_nElem) {
4245 /* Local element ID of the first element. Per definition this is
4246 always a locally stored element. Also store its time level. */
4247 const unsigned long elemID0 = FI->elemID0 - beg_node[rank];
4248 const unsigned short timeLevel0 = elem[elemID0]->GetTimeLevel();
4249
4250 /* Determine the status of the second element. */
4251 if (FI->elemID1 >= beg_node[rank] && FI->elemID1 < beg_node[rank] + nElem) {
4252 /* Both elements are stored locally. Determine the local
4253 element of the second element and determine the minimum
4254 time level. */
4255 const unsigned long elemID1 = FI->elemID1 - beg_node[rank];
4256 const unsigned short timeLevel1 = elem[elemID1]->GetTimeLevel();
4257 const unsigned short timeLevel = min(timeLevel0, timeLevel1);
4258
4259 /* If the time level of either element is larger than timeLevel+1,
4260 adapt the time levels and indicate that the local situation
4261 has changed. */
4262 if (timeLevel0 > timeLevel + 1) {
4263 elem[elemID0]->SetTimeLevel(timeLevel + 1);
4264 localSituationChanged = 1;
4265 }
4266
4267 if (timeLevel1 > timeLevel + 1) {
4268 elem[elemID1]->SetTimeLevel(timeLevel + 1);
4269 localSituationChanged = 1;
4270 }
4271 } else {
4272 /* The second element is stored on a different processor.
4273 Retrieve its time level from mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel
4274 and determine the minimum time level. */
4275 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(FI->elemID1);
4276 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end())
4277 SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4278 const unsigned short timeLevel = min(timeLevel0, MI->second.short0);
4279
4280 /* If the time level of either element is larger than timeLevel+1,
4281 adapt the time levels and indicate that the local situation
4282 has changed. */
4283 if (timeLevel0 > timeLevel + 1) {
4284 elem[elemID0]->SetTimeLevel(timeLevel + 1);
4285 localSituationChanged = 1;
4286 }
4287
4288 if (MI->second.short0 > timeLevel + 1) {
4289 MI->second.short0 = timeLevel + 1;
4290 localSituationChanged = 1;
4291 }
4292 }
4293 }
4294 }
4295
4296 /* Determine whether or not the global situation changed. If not
4297 the infinite loop can be terminated. */
4298 unsigned short globalSituationChanged = localSituationChanged;
4299
4300#ifdef HAVE_MPI
4301 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&localSituationChanged, &globalSituationChanged, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MPI_MAX,
4302 SU2_MPI::GetComm());
4303#endif
4304 if (!globalSituationChanged) break;
4305
4306 /*--- Communicate the information of the externals, if needed. ---*/
4307#ifdef HAVE_MPI
4308
4309 /*--- Copy the information of the time level into the send buffers
4310 and send the data using non-blocking sends. Note that the size
4311 of sendElem is used and not sendBuf, because the size of sendBuf
4312 is twice the size, see step 4. ---*/
4313 for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
4314 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < sendElem[i].size(); ++j) sendBuf[i][j] = elem[sendElem[i][j]]->GetTimeLevel();
4315
4316 SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBuf[i].data(), sendElem[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, sendRank[i], sendRank[i],
4317 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &sendReqs[i]);
4318 }
4319
4320 /*--- Receive the data for the externals. As this data is needed
4321 immediately, blocking communication is used. The time level of the
4322 externals is stored in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel, whose second
4323 element, which contains the time level, is updated accordingly.
4324 Note that the minimum of the two levels is taken, such that changes
4325 for the external are also incorporated. As such this information
4326 must be returned to the original rank. Also note that the size
4327 of recvElem is used and not returnBuf, because the latter is twice
4328 as large, see step 4. ---*/
4329 MRI = mapRankToIndRecv.begin();
4330 for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i, ++MRI) {
4331 SU2_MPI::Status status;
4332 SU2_MPI::Recv(returnBuf[i].data(), recvElem[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MRI->first, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
4333 &status);
4334
4335 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < recvElem[i].size(); ++j) {
4336 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(recvElem[i][j]);
4337 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end())
4338 SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4339 MI->second.short0 = min(returnBuf[i][j], MI->second.short0);
4340 returnBuf[i][j] = MI->second.short0;
4341 }
4342
4343 SU2_MPI::Isend(returnBuf[i].data(), recvElem[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MRI->first, MRI->first + 1,
4344 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &returnReqs[i]);
4345 }
4346
4347 /* Complete the first round of nonblocking sends, such that the
4348 original send buffers can be used as receive buffers for the
4349 second round of messages. */
4350 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, sendReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
4351
4352 /* Loop again over the original sending processors to receive
4353 the updated time level of elements that may have been updated
4354 on other ranks. */
4355 for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
4356 SU2_MPI::Status status;
4357 SU2_MPI::Recv(sendBuf[i].data(), sendElem[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, sendRank[i], rank + 1,
4358 SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
4359
4360 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < sendElem[i].size(); ++j) elem[sendElem[i][j]]->SetTimeLevel(sendBuf[i][j]);
4361 }
4362
4363 /* Complete the second round of nonblocking sends. */
4364 SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankRecv, returnReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
4365#endif
4366 }
4367
4368 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4369 /*--- Step 6: Print a nice output about the number of elements per ---*/
4370 /*--- time level. ---*/
4371 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4372
4373 if (rank == MASTER_NODE)
4374 cout << endl << "------- Element distribution for time accurate local time stepping ------" << endl;
4375
4376 /* Determine the local number of elements per time level. */
4377 vector<unsigned long> nLocalElemPerLevel(nTimeLevels, 0);
4378 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) ++nLocalElemPerLevel[elem[i]->GetTimeLevel()];
4379
4380 /* Determine the global version of nLocalElemPerLevel. This only needs to
4381 be known on the master node. */
4382 vector<unsigned long> nGlobalElemPerLevel = nLocalElemPerLevel;
4383
4384#ifdef HAVE_MPI
4385 SU2_MPI::Reduce(nLocalElemPerLevel.data(), nGlobalElemPerLevel.data(), nTimeLevels, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM,
4386 MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
4387#endif
4388
4389 /* Write the output. */
4390 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
4391 for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeLevels; ++i) {
4392 if (nGlobalElemPerLevel[i])
4393 cout << "Number of elements time level " << i << ": " << nGlobalElemPerLevel[i] << endl;
4394 }
4395 }
4396 }
4397}
4398
4399void CPhysicalGeometry::ComputeFEMGraphWeights(CConfig* config, const vector<CFaceOfElement>& localFaces,
4400 const vector<vector<unsigned long> >& adjacency,
4401 const map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T>& mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel,
4402 vector<su2double>& vwgt, vector<vector<su2double> >& adjwgt) {
4403 /*--- Determine the maximum time level that occurs in the grid. ---*/
4404 unsigned short maxTimeLevel = 0;
4405 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) maxTimeLevel = max(maxTimeLevel, elem[i]->GetTimeLevel());
4406
4407#ifdef HAVE_MPI
4408 unsigned short maxTimeLevelLocal = maxTimeLevel;
4409 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&maxTimeLevelLocal, &maxTimeLevel, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MPI_MAX, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
4410#endif
4411
4412 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4413 /* Step 1: Determine the vertex weights of the graph. Per element two */
4414 /* weights are determined. The first weight is proportional to the */
4415 /* amount of work for the volume element. The second weight is the */
4416 /* number of DOFs of the element, such that the number of DOFs per */
4417 /* rank will also be the same. */
4418 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4419
4420 /*--- Define the standard elements for the volume elements, the boundary faces
4421 and the matching internal faces. ---*/
4422 vector<CFEMStandardElement> standardElements;
4423 vector<CFEMStandardBoundaryFace> standardBoundaryFaces;
4424 vector<CFEMStandardInternalFace> standardMatchingFaces;
4425
4426 /*--- Loop over the elements to determine the amount of computational work.
4427 This amount has a contribution from both the volume integral and
4428 surface integral to allow for Discontinuous and Continuous Galerkin
4429 schemes. For the latter the contribution of the surface integral will
4430 be negligible to the total amount of work. ---*/
4431 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
4432 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4433 /*--- Determine the computational weight of the volume integral in the ---*/
4434 /*--- (DG-)FEM formulation. ---*/
4435 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4436
4437 /* Easier storage of the two indices for the vertex weights of this element. */
4438 const unsigned long ind0 = 2 * i;
4439 const unsigned long ind1 = ind0 + 1;
4440
4441 /*--- Determine the corresponding standard element for this volume element.
4442 Create it, if it does not exist. ---*/
4443 unsigned short VTK_Type = elem[i]->GetVTK_Type();
4444 unsigned short nPolySol = elem[i]->GetNPolySol();
4445 bool JacIsConstant = elem[i]->GetJacobianConsideredConstant();
4446
4447 unsigned long ii;
4448 for (ii = 0; ii < standardElements.size(); ++ii) {
4449 if (standardElements[ii].SameStandardElement(VTK_Type, nPolySol, JacIsConstant)) break;
4450 }
4451
4452 if (ii == standardElements.size()) standardElements.emplace_back(VTK_Type, nPolySol, JacIsConstant, config);
4453
4454 /* Initialize the computational work for this element, which is stored
4455 in the 1st vertex weight. */
4456 vwgt[ind0] = standardElements[ii].WorkEstimateMetis(config);
4457
4458 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4459 /*--- Determine the computational weight of the surface integral in ---*/
4460 /*--- the (DG-)FEM formulation. ---*/
4461 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4462
4463 /* Determine the global element ID of this element. */
4464 unsigned long elemID = beg_node[rank] + i;
4465
4466 /*--- Get the global IDs of the corner points of all the faces of this element. ---*/
4467 unsigned short nFaces;
4468 unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
4469 unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
4470
4471 elem[i]->GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
4472
4473 /*--- Loop over the number of faces of this element. ---*/
4474 for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nFaces; ++j) {
4475 /* Determine the VTK type of the face. */
4476 unsigned short VTK_Type_Face = 0;
4477 switch (nPointsPerFace[j]) {
4478 case 2:
4479 VTK_Type_Face = LINE;
4480 break;
4481 case 3:
4482 VTK_Type_Face = TRIANGLE;
4483 break;
4484 case 4:
4485 VTK_Type_Face = QUADRILATERAL;
4486 break;
4487 }
4488
4489 /* Easier storage whether or not the Jacobian is constant. */
4490 JacIsConstant = elem[i]->GetJacobianConstantFace(j);
4491
4492 /*--- Check if this is a matching internal face. ---*/
4493 CFaceOfElement thisFace;
4494 thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[j];
4495 for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nPointsPerFace[j]; ++k) thisFace.cornerPoints[k] = faceConn[j][k];
4496 thisFace.CreateUniqueNumbering();
4497
4498 vector<CFaceOfElement>::const_iterator low;
4499 low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
4500
4501 bool thisFaceFound = false;
4502 if (low != localFaces.end()) {
4503 if (!(thisFace < *low)) thisFaceFound = true;
4504 }
4505
4506 if (thisFaceFound) {
4507 /* Check if this internal matching face is owned by this element. */
4508 bool faceIsOwned;
4509 if (elemID == low->elemID0)
4510 faceIsOwned = low->elem0IsOwner;
4511 else
4512 faceIsOwned = !low->elem0IsOwner;
4513
4514 if (faceIsOwned) {
4515 /*--- Determine the index of the corresponding standard matching
4516 face. If it does not exist, create it. ---*/
4517 for (ii = 0; ii < standardMatchingFaces.size(); ++ii) {
4518 if (standardMatchingFaces[ii].SameStandardMatchingFace(VTK_Type_Face, JacIsConstant, low->elemType0,
4519 low->nPolySol0, low->elemType1, low->nPolySol1,
4520 false, false))
4521 break;
4522 }
4523
4524 if (ii == standardMatchingFaces.size())
4525 standardMatchingFaces.emplace_back(VTK_Type_Face, low->elemType0, low->nPolySol0, low->elemType1,
4526 low->nPolySol1, JacIsConstant, false, false, config);
4527
4528 /* Update the computational work for this element, i.e. the 1st
4529 vertex weight. */
4530 vwgt[ind0] += standardMatchingFaces[ii].WorkEstimateMetis(config);
4531 }
4532 } else {
4533 /*--- This is a boundary face, which is owned by definition. Determine
4534 the index of the corresponding standard boundary face. If it
4535 does not exist, create it. ---*/
4536 for (ii = 0; ii < standardBoundaryFaces.size(); ++ii) {
4537 if (standardBoundaryFaces[ii].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type_Face, JacIsConstant, VTK_Type, nPolySol,
4538 false))
4539 break;
4540 }
4541
4542 if (ii == standardBoundaryFaces.size())
4543 standardBoundaryFaces.emplace_back(VTK_Type_Face, VTK_Type, nPolySol, JacIsConstant, false, config);
4544
4545 /* Update the computational work for this element, i.e. the 1st
4546 vertex weight. */
4547 vwgt[ind0] += standardBoundaryFaces[ii].WorkEstimateMetis(config);
4548 }
4549 }
4550
4551 /* Set the value of the second vertex weight to the number of DOFs. */
4552 vwgt[ind1] = elem[i]->GetNDOFsSol();
4553 }
4554
4555 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4556 /*--- Check for boundary faces for which a wall function treatment ---*/
4557 /*--- must be used. This type of boundary condition treatment is ---*/
4558 /*--- computationally intensive and must be added to the vertex weight ---*/
4559 /*--- of the corresponding element. ---*/
4560 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4561
4562 /* Loop over the markers and select the ones for which a wall function
4563 treatment must be carried out. */
4564 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
4565 switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
4566 case ISOTHERMAL:
4567 case HEAT_FLUX: {
4568 const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
4569 if (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != WALL_FUNCTIONS::NONE) {
4570 /* Retrieve the integer information for this boundary marker.
4571 The number of points in normal direction for the wall function
4572 treatment is the first element of this array. */
4573 const unsigned short* shortInfo = config->GetWallFunction_IntInfo(Marker_Tag);
4574
4575 /* Loop over the local boundary elements for this marker. */
4576 for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; ++l) {
4577 /* Get the required data to define the standard boundary element. */
4578
4579 /* Easier storage of the element type, the corresponding volume
4580 element, the polynomial degree for the solution and whether or
4581 not the Jacobian can be considered constant. */
4582 const unsigned short VTK_Type_Face = bound[iMarker][l]->GetVTK_Type();
4583 const unsigned long elemID = bound[iMarker][l]->GetDomainElement() - beg_node[rank];
4584 const unsigned short nPolySol = elem[elemID]->GetNPolySol();
4585 const unsigned short VTK_Type_Elem = elem[elemID]->GetVTK_Type();
4586 const bool JacIsConstant = bound[iMarker][l]->GetJacobianConsideredConstant();
4587
4588 /* Determine the corresponding entry in the standard elements for
4589 boundary faces. This entry must be found. */
4590 unsigned long ii;
4591 for (ii = 0; ii < standardBoundaryFaces.size(); ++ii) {
4592 if (standardBoundaryFaces[ii].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type_Face, JacIsConstant, VTK_Type_Elem,
4593 nPolySol, false))
4594 break;
4595 }
4596
4597 if (ii == standardBoundaryFaces.size())
4598 SU2_MPI::Error("No matching standard boundary element found", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4599
4600 /* Update the computational work for the corresponding volume element,
4601 i.e. the 1st vertex weight. */
4602 vwgt[2 * elemID] += standardBoundaryFaces[ii].WorkEstimateMetisWallFunctions(config, shortInfo[0]);
4603 }
4604 }
4605
4606 break;
4607 }
4608
4609 default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
4610 break;
4611 }
4612 }
4613
4614 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4615 /*--- The final weight is obtained by taking the amount of work in time ---*/
4616 /*--- into account. Note that this correction is only relevant when time ---*/
4617 /*--- accurate local time stepping is employed. ---*/
4618 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4619
4620 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
4621 const unsigned short diffLevel = maxTimeLevel - elem[i]->GetTimeLevel();
4622 vwgt[2 * i] *= pow(2, diffLevel);
4623 }
4624
4625 /*--- Determine the minimum of the workload of the elements, i.e. 1st vertex
4626 weight, over the entire domain. ---*/
4627 su2double minvwgt = vwgt[0];
4628 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) minvwgt = min(minvwgt, vwgt[2 * i]);
4629
4630#ifdef HAVE_MPI
4631 su2double locminvwgt = minvwgt;
4632 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&locminvwgt, &minvwgt, 1, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_MIN, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
4633#endif
4634
4635 /*--- Scale the workload of the elements, the 1st vertex weight, with the
4636 minimum value and multiply by 100, such that the conversion to integer
4637 weights (ParMETIS is using integers for the weights) does not lead to
4638 a significant increase in the load imbalance. ---*/
4639 minvwgt = 100.0 / minvwgt;
4640 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) vwgt[2 * i] *= minvwgt;
4641
4642 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4643 /* Step 2: Determine the adjacency weights, which are proportional to the */
4644 /* amount of communication needed when the two neighboring */
4645 /* elements are stored on different ranks. */
4646 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4647
4648 /*--- Determine the edge weights by a double loop over the local elements
4649 and its edges. The map mapElemIDsToFaceInd is used to determine
4650 the corresponding index in localFaces. ---*/
4651 for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nElem; ++i) {
4652 /* Easier storage of the time level of the current element and the
4653 number of solution DOFs. */
4654 const unsigned short timeLevel0 = elem[i]->GetTimeLevel();
4655 const unsigned short nDOFs0 = elem[i]->GetNDOFsSol();
4656
4657 /* Loop over the number of entries in the graph for this element. */
4658 for (unsigned long j = 0; j < adjacency[i].size(); ++j) {
4659 /* Define the variables for the time level and number of solution
4660 DOFs for the neighboring element. */
4661 unsigned short timeLevel1, nDOFs1;
4662
4663 /* Check if the neighor is stored locally. */
4664 if (adjacency[i][j] >= beg_node[rank] && adjacency[i][j] < beg_node[rank] + nElem) {
4665 /* Locally stored element. Determine its local ID and set the
4666 time level and number of solution DOFs. */
4667 unsigned long elemID1 = adjacency[i][j] - beg_node[rank];
4668 timeLevel1 = elem[elemID1]->GetTimeLevel();
4669 nDOFs1 = elem[elemID1]->GetNDOFsSol();
4670 } else {
4671 /* The neighbor is an external element. Find it in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel
4672 and set the time level and number of solution DOFs accordingly. */
4673 map<unsigned long, CUnsignedShort2T>::const_iterator MI;
4674 MI = mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.find(adjacency[i][j]);
4675 if (MI == mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel.end())
4676 SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapExternalElemIDToTimeLevel", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4677 timeLevel1 = MI->second.short0;
4678 nDOFs1 = MI->second.short1;
4679 }
4680
4681 /* Determine the difference of the maximum time level that occurs and
4682 the minimum of the time level of the current and the adjacent element.
4683 This value can only be nonzero when time accurate local time stepping
4684 is employed. */
4685 const unsigned short diffLevel = maxTimeLevel - min(timeLevel0, timeLevel1);
4686
4687 /* Set the edge weight. As ParMetis expects an undirected graph, set the edge weight
4688 to the sum of the number of DOFs on both sides, multiplied by the weight factor
4689 to account for different time levels. */
4690 adjwgt[i][j] = pow(2, diffLevel) * (nDOFs0 + nDOFs1);
4691 }
4692 }
4693}
